I told the charlatan the whole tragic story and of course he was delighted. After all, tragedy is his stock in trade. It didn't take him long to come up with a plan.
Şarlatana trajik hikayenin tamamını anlattım ve tabi oldukça memnun kaldı. Ne de olsa, trajedi adamın işinde lazım bir şey. Adamın bir plan oluşturması uzun sürmedi.
Now to get back to the charlatan and tell him the whole story.
Şimdi şarlatanın yanına dönüp bütün hikayeyi anlatma zamanı.
Done. Now everyone in Ledetchko thinks their hens are hexed.
Tamadır. Artık herkes Ledetchko'daki tavukların büyülendiğini sanıyor.
Since Lev was stealing eggs and he was a charcoal-burner, what better way to make it look like he's returned from the dead than to steal eggs from chicken coops and replace them with charcoal?
Lev yumurta çalıyordu ve kömürcüydü. İnsanlara onun hortladığını düşündürmek için kümeslerdeki yumurtaları kömürlerle değiştirmekten daha iyi ne olabilir ki?
Now even the butcher has to admit to believing in the revenant. Either that or get a bad reputation for selling rotten meat.
Artık kasabın bile hortlağa inandığını itiraf etmesi lazım. Ya öyle yapacak ya da kötü et sattığı için itibarı zedelenecek.
What an idiot I am! I got caught in the act, and now it won't be easy to frighten the villagers.
Ben tam bir salağım! İş üzerinde yakalandım ve artık köylüleri korkutmak hiç de kolay olmayacak.
The charlatan says a revenant can make meat go bad by touching it and I should do just that. I don't have that kind of power though, so I'll have to switch the meat at the butcher's.
Şarlatan hortlakların etlere dokunup onları bozabildiğini söyledi. Benim de yapmam gereken bu. Tabi benim öyle güçlerim olmadığından kasap dükkanındaki etleri bozuklarıyla değiştirmem lazım.
The charlatan didn't exactly make the job easy for me, but in the end I brewed the potion and poured it into the baths. And I must say, the effect made even me feel a bit uneasy.
Şarlatan işimi pek kolaylaştırmadı ama sonunda iksiri yapıp hamam suyuna döktüm. Dürüst olmak gerekirse suyun aldığı hal beni bile biraz rahatsız etti.

I failed. I was caught red-handed... literally, colouring the water at the baths. With a bit of luck, no one will connect it with the other things, but as far as "water into blood" is concerned, the game's up.
Başarısız oldum. Hamam suyunu renklendirirken iş üzerinde yakalandım. Şansım yaver giderse kimse bunu diğer olanlara bağlamaz ama "suyun kana dönmesi" işi yaş oldu.
"And the water turned to blood". Nothing original, the charlatan says, but at least tried and tested. He recommended some potion for the job. Now if I only knew what the hell he was talking about...
"Ve sular kan oldu". Şarlatanın dediğine göre özgün bir fikir olmasa da güvenli bir liman. İşi görecek bir iksir önerdi. Keşke neden bahsettiğini biliyor olsaydım.
Most of the villagers' rosaries have vanished and the people are shaking with fear.
Köylülerin çoğunun tespihleri kayboldu ve insanlar korkuyorlar.
To deprive the villagers of their peace of mind, I'm supposed to steal their rosary beads. Or, as the charlatan put it, "replace them with nothing."
Köylüleri korkutmak için onların tespihlerini çalmam gerek ya da şarlatanın sözleriyle "hiçbir şeyler değiştirmem" gerek.
It took a lot of running around investigating, but in the end I got to the bottom of this affair with Josef. The Bailiff was satisfied and he paid me a decent reward.
It took a lot of running around investigating, but in the end I got to the bottom of this affair with Josef. The Bailiff was satisfied and he paid me a decent reward.
The Bailiff is having trouble with a local farmer, Josef, so I promised him I'd look into it and try to fix things.
The Bailiff is having trouble with a local farmer, Josef, so I promised him I'd look into it and try to fix things.
Henry was working up a sweat at the stockade training swordfighting. Bianca wanted to bring him a beer, but she couldn't leave the tavern, so I did it for her.
Henry was working up a sweat at the stockade training swordfighting. Bianca wanted to bring him a beer, but she couldn't leave the tavern, so I did it for her.
Henry was working up a sweat at the stockade training swordfighting. Bianca wanted to bring him a beer, but she couldn't leave the tavern. I promised to do it for her, but I didn't.
Henry was working up a sweat at the stockade training swordfighting. Bianca wanted to bring him a beer, but she couldn't leave the tavern. I promised to do it for her, but I didn't.
Henry is working up a sweat at the stockade training swordfighting. Bianca would like to bring him a beer, but she can't leave the tavern, so I promised to help her out.
Henry is working up a sweat at the stockade training swordfighting. Bianca would like to bring him a beer, but she can't leave the tavern, so I promised to help her out.

After Johanka's sermon, the tailor's wife came to ask her for help with some troubles with her husband. Johanka has enough on her own plate, so she asked me to see what I could do and of course I agreed.

After Johanka's sermon, the tailor's wife came to ask her for help with some troubles with her husband. Johanka has enough on her own plate, so she asked me to see what I could do and of course I agreed.
After Johanka's sermon, the tailor's wife came to ask her for help with some troubles with her husband. Johanka has enough on her own plate, so she asked me to see what I could do. Well, let's see...
After Johanka's sermon, the tailor's wife came to ask her for help with some troubles with her husband. Johanka has enough on her own plate, so she asked me to see what I could do. Well, let's see...
Tinker is used to getting fed every morning, so I gave him something to eat.
Tinker is used to getting fed every morning, so I gave him something to eat.
Tinker is used to getting fed every morning, but I haven't given him anything to eat.
Tinker is used to getting fed every morning, but I haven't given him anything to eat.
Tinker is used to getting fed every morning and today is no exception. I have to feed him as usual.
Tinker is used to getting fed every morning and today is no exception. I have to feed him as usual.
We can't survey Pribyslavitz in the dark. I'd better come and see the Locator during daylight hours.
Pribyslavitz'i karanlıkta araştıramayız. Yer Bulucu ile gün içinde konuşsam daha iyi olacak.
I've been officially appointed Bailiff and some new settlers are already on their way to Pribyslavitz. Now it's time to start with the actual renewal of the village.
Resmi olarak Başmuhafız olarak atandım ve birkaç yeni yerleşimci de Pribyslavitz'e doğru yola çıktı. Artık köyün yenilenme işine gerçekten başlayabiliriz.
I took Sir Divish's announcement to the Rattay Bailiff and he will make the public proclamation, which I should be there for, since it concerns me personally...
Sör Divish'in bildirgesini Rattay Başmuhafızına götürdüm, Başmuhafız halka duyuru yapacak, benim de orada bizzat bulunmam gerekli.
I should talk to Johanka about it.
I should talk to Johanka about it.

While the charlatan is thinking up some way of frightening the fellow who's afraid of fire, I have to deal with the one who's afraid of wild animals. Making terrifying animal calls ought to do the trick. Who could teach me that, I wonder?

Şarlatan ateşten korkan arkadaştan kurtulmanın bir yolunu ararken benim de hayvanlardan korkanın icabına bakmam gerek. Korkunç hayvan sesleri çıkarmak işe yarayacaktır. Böyle şeyleri bana kim öğretebilir acaba?

I need to take Ambrose for everything he has, so he loses his taste for the game. I'll have to bait him by letting him win a couple of times and see if he bites. I mustn't botch it. He'll be leaving for Kuttenberg soon and I might not get a second chance to play him, so there's no time to waste.

I need to take Ambrose for everything he has, so he loses his taste for the game. I'll have to bait him by letting him win a couple of times and see if he bites. I mustn't botch it. He'll be leaving for Kuttenberg soon and I might not get a second chance to play him, so there's no time to waste.
I've got the Groschen, time to get stuck into playing.
I've got the Groschen, time to get stuck into playing.
I need to have enough coin to match whatever Ambrose has and more. Thirteen hundred Groschen should be about right.
I need to have enough coin to match whatever Ambrose has and more. Thirteen hundred Groschen should be about right.
I've got enough linen to bandage Samuel's wounds.
I've got enough linen to bandage Samuel's wounds.
Samuel's wounds have started bleeding again. I'll have to find some linen to bandage them.
Samuel's wounds have started bleeding again. I'll have to find some linen to bandage them.
I found some marigold to put on Samuel's wounds.
I found some marigold to put on Samuel's wounds.
I need to find healing herbs for Samuel's wounds. Ten marigold plants should do.
I need to find healing herbs for Samuel's wounds. Ten marigold plants should do.
Now the army has pulled out, it should be safe enough to go and see if anyone survived behind the walls.
Now the army has pulled out, it should be safe enough to go and see if anyone survived behind the walls.
Before Johanka had even finished speaking, some fellows came along to break up the congregation. We soon taught them some manners.
Before Johanka had even finished speaking, some fellows came along to break up the congregation. We soon taught them some manners.

Before Johanka had even finished speaking, some fellows came along to break up the congregation. We wanted to teach them some manners, but it didn't quite work out. I only hope this kind of thing won't happen again and they'll leave Johanka in peace.

Before Johanka had even finished speaking, some fellows came along to break up the congregation. We wanted to teach them some manners, but it didn't quite work out. I only hope this kind of thing won't happen again and they'll leave Johanka in peace.

Before Johanka had even finished speaking, some fellows came along to break up the congregation. That's not going to happen! As long as I'm around, no one is going to make trouble for Johanka! What they need to learn some manners is a good beating! I'd better make sure it doesn't get out of hand though. If someone gets cut or worse, it could mean serious trouble.

Before Johanka had even finished speaking, some fellows came along to break up the congregation. That's not going to happen! As long as I'm around, no one is going to make trouble for Johanka! What they need to learn some manners is a good beating! I'd better make sure it doesn't get out of hand though. If someone gets cut or worse, it could mean serious trouble.
I should go and see if Johanka is alright.
I should go and see if Johanka is alright.
If Andrew's plan is to work, the robbery mustn't succeed!
Eğer Andrew'in planı işe yarayacaksa, hırsızlık başarıya ulaşmamalı!

Sir Divish was delighted with the renewal of Pribyslavitz and rewarded me and Marius for getting the job done. The village is now a thriving settlement and I am entitled to all the profit from it! I'll be happy to come back now and again and see how things are going.

Sör Divish, Pribyslavitz'in yenilenmesinden memnun oldu ve Marius ile beni yapılan iş için ödüllendirdi. Köy, yaşayan bir yerleşim yeri hâline geldi ve gelecek bütün gelir de bana ait! Arada sırada gelip işlerin nasıl gittiğini görmek hoş olacak.
I've finished everything that needed doing. Now I must report to Sir Divish that the reconstruction of the village is at an end.
Yapılmasını gereken her şeyi yaptım. Köyün yenilenmesinin sona erdiğini artık Sör Divish'e söylemem gerek.
My a stroke of misfortune, Locator Marius didn't survive to get his survey of Pribyslavitz finished. I'd better report the sad news to Sir Divish.
Yer Bulucu Marius ne yazık ki Pribyslavitz araştırmasını tamamlayamadan hayatını kaybetti. Kötü haberleri Sör Divish'e haber etsem iyi olur.

I went to see Sir Hans to find out how his amorous encounter with Karolina ended up. Frankly, though, I can't see what he finds so appealing about her. Unless it's her lingering fragrance of smoked sausage?

Karolina'yla olan şehvet dolu macerasının nasıl olduğunu öğrenmek için Sör Hans'ın yanına gittim. Yalnız kızın nesini beğendiğini bir türlü anlayamadım. Buram buram sosis kokmasına vurulduysa bilemem tabi.
The night-time rendezvous is over. And I hope there won't be a repeat of it anytime soon! I must go and see Sir Hans in the morning to find out how it went.
Buluşma bitti. Umarım yakın zamanda yeniden buluşulmaz! Sabah Sör Hans'ın yanına gidip neler olduğunu öğreneyim.
I took Marius' report to Sir Divish. He was very pleased and wants to visit Pribyslavitz in person.
Marius'un raporunu Sör Divish'e götürdüm. Çok memnundu, Pribyslavitz'i bizzat kendisi görmek istiyor.
Marius gave me a dispatch for Sir Divish containing his report on the state of Pribyslavitz.
Marius, Sör Divish'e götürmem için Pribyslavitz vilayetine dair raporunu verdi.
On my mission to save the soul of a Ledetchko prostitute, I went straight to Adela, who I already knew since the time I was investigating the Neuhof raid.
On my mission to save the soul of a Ledetchko prostitute, I went straight to Adela, who I already knew since the time I was investigating the Neuhof raid.
As it happens, I know Adela since the time I questioned her during my investigation of the raid on the Neuhof stables. She's a bath wench who fits the bill perfectly.
As it happens, I know Adela since the time I questioned her during my investigation of the raid on the Neuhof stables. She's a bath wench who fits the bill perfectly.
Johanka sent me to Ledetchko to find a prostitute and redeem her. I think I found someone who fits the bill.
Johanka sent me to Ledetchko to find a prostitute and redeem her. I think I found someone who fits the bill.
I don't know how I'm supposed to go about finding this prostitute. I'll just have to figure it out somehow.
I don't know how I'm supposed to go about finding this prostitute. I'll just have to figure it out somehow.
The prostitute was getting some rough treatment, but I decided not to get mixed up in it and come back the next day.
The prostitute was getting some rough treatment, but I decided not to get mixed up in it and come back the next day.

Sir Divish wasn't at all happy about my handling of Pribyslavitz and dismissed me from the office of Bailiff. I don't know if I could have done something better - perhaps I'm not cut out for public office.
Sör Divish, Pribyslavitz'i idare edişimden hiç mutlu olmadı ve beni Başmuhafızlık görevinden aldı. Daha iyisini yapabilirdim bilmiyorum ama belki de yönetim kademesine uygun değilimdir.
I'd better go to Sir Divish and explain to him what's happened. The Pribyslavitz settlers are very disgruntled with the way things are going.
Sör Divish'e gidip olanı biten açıklasam iyi olur. Pribyslavitz sakinleri, işleyişten çok şikâyetçiler.

Marius explained to me how the actual construction work proceeds. He will enter all the information in the accounts ledger. He also told me there's a trunk where I have to put the money needed for building houses and paying workers. And when the village starts earning its own way, that income will go in the trunk too.

Marius bana asıl inşaat işinin nasıl olduğunu anlattı. Bütün bilgileri hesap defterine girecek. Ayrıca ev inşa etmek ve işçilere para vermek için gereken parayı koyacağım bir sandığın olduğunu da söyledi. Köy kendi kendine para kazanmaya başlayınca bu gelir de sandığa girecek.
I'm officially Bailiff of Pribyslavitz and now it's up to me to see to the renewal of the settlement. I'm not sure quite how to go about it, though. I'd best talk to Marius about how to proceed.
Resmi olarak Pribyslavitz'in Başmuhafızı oldum, artık yerleşim yerinin yenilenmesi benim elime bakıyor. Nasıl yapacağımızı pek bilmiyorum ama. En iyisi ilerleyişle ilgili Marius ile konuşmak.
The church is standing. It took a lot of effort and coin, but it was worth it.
Kilise sapasağlam oldu. Çok kas gücü ve altın gerektirdi ama buna değdi.
I have the task of renewing the church. It won't be enough just to repair it - I'll also have to see to getting a new altar and ornament of the interior.
Kiliseyi yenilemeliyim. Sadece tamir etmek de yetmeyecek, ayrıca yeni bir sunak ve iç dekorasyonla da ilgilenmeliyim.
The village is now earning a decent income. I had to pay out a lot from my own purse, but now I'll start getting it all back with interest.
Köy şu anda makul bir gelir sağlıyor. Kendi cebimden çok verdim ama artık hepsini fazlasıyla geri alma zamanı.
The village must pay its own way, otherwise I'll soon be ruined. I'd better make sure everything runs as profitably as possible.
Köy kendi masrafını çıkarmalı, yoksa batarım. Her şeyin olabildiğince kâr etmesini sağlasam iyi olur.
Pribyslavitz is now capable of housing lots of people. There are buildings enough and no shortage of living space.
Pribyslavitz artık birçok insana ev sahipliği yapabilir. Yeterince bina ve yaşam alanı var.

The village will have to be expanded even more, so I have the task of providing sufficient living space. That way, anyone interested in starting a new life can move here without fear of ending up without a roof over their heads.
Köyün daha da çok genişlemesi gerekecek, bu yüzden yeterli yaşam alanını sağlamam gerekli. Bu şekilde yeni bir hayata başlamak isteyen herkes, evsiz kalma korkusu olmadan buraya taşınabilir.
The whole village is shaking with fear! Looks like the plan worked!
Bütün köyü korku sarmış! Görünüşe göre plan işe yaramış!

Things didn't work out quite as planned. Everyone knows it was me who was trying to scare the villagers. I'd better stay out of the way before an angry mob comes looking for me. And the charlatan won't be happy either...

İşler tam olarak planladığımız gibi gitmedi. Herkes köylüleri korkutmaya çalışanın ben olduğumu öğrendi. Öfkeli kalabalık peşime düşmeden önce ortadan kaybolsam iyi olacak. Bu iş şarlatanın da hiç hoşuna gitmeyecek.
The charlatan gave me the job of haunting Ledetchko and he has a few ideas how to go about it. Maybe I'll come up with something of my own too... The main thing is not to get caught!
Şarlatan Ledetchko'nun başına musallat olmamı istedi ve bunu nasıl yapacağıma dair birkaç fikir de verdi. Belki ben de kendi fikirlerimden bir şeyler katarım. Esas önemli olan yakalanmamak!
I should go and see the charlatan from time to time to see how well I'm doing at haunting the villagers.
Ara ara gidip musallat olma konusunda ne kadar başarılı olduğumu öğrenmek için şarlatanı görmeliyim.
I buried Lev's remains in Rattay and now he can finally rest in peace, may God have mercy on him.
Lev'den kalanları Rattay'da gömdüm ve artık biraz da olsa huzur bulabilecek. Tanrı günahlarını affetsin.
The remains of that poor wretch have been weighing heavy on my shoulders and my soul. I must bury them, as the charlatan said, in hallowed ground, which I suppose means in Rattay.
Zavallı adamın kalıntılarını taşımaktan dolayı vicdan azabı çekiyorum. Onları şarlatanın da dediği gibi kutsal toprağa gömmeliyim. O da görünüşe bakılırsa Rattay demek oluyor.
I found all the meat at the butcher's. There are chickens hanging in the courtyard and lamb inside, but to my surprise, there's also venison hidden away in the pantry.
Kasabın bütün etlerini buldum. Dışarıda tavuk etleri asılı ve içeride de koyun eti var. Ancak kilerde de geyik eti olması beni şaşırttı.
I have to find all the meat the butcher has, so I can replace it with rotten stuff.
Bozuk olanlarıyla değiştirmek için kasabın bütün etlerini bulmam gerek.
I did it. It turned out to be just poppy, St. John's wort and thistle. Quite easy really, just grind everything and brew it together in wine for one turn.
Başardım. Otlar gelincik out, Aziz John otu ve deve dikeniymiş. Aslında gayet kolay; herpsini beraberce ez ve şarapla birlikte bri tur kaynat.
I must ask the charlatan about that recipe for "turning water into blood". Couldn't possibly be anything too difficult, right?
"Suyu kana dönüştürme" tarifini şarlatana sormalıyım. Bu kadar zor olması gerek, değil mi?
All I had to do was throw some rotten eggs in the well and now the villagers believe it's the gateway to Hell itself.
Tek yapmam gereken kuyunun içne birkaç yumurta atmak oldu ve şimdi köylüler kuyunun cehenneme açılan bir kapı olduğuna inanıyorlar.
Damn it, I should have been more careful. Now the villagers will know the spoiled water was my doing and they'll... well, kick up a stink.
Lanet olsun, daha dikkatli olmam gerekirdi. Köylüler suların kokmasında benim parmağım olduğunu anlayacaklar ve sorun çıkaracaklar.
Rotten eggs give off a real stink - a diabolical stink, like brimstone. That could surely be put to use. Maybe poison their water with them?
Bozuk yumurtalar da ne kokuyormuş. Şeytani bir koku resmen, kükürt gibi. Bu işe yarayabilir. Belki de köylülerin sularını zehirlerim.

The Bailiff asked me to deal with a band of itinerants who've been hanging around the area. He suspects them of having dug up that grave. Not only can I make a bit of coin out of helping him, but maybe I can also use this to my benefit...?
Başmuhafız bölgede takılan bir grup gezginin icabına bakmamı istedi. Mezarı kazanın onlar olduğundan şüpheleniyor. Bu işten hem biraz para kazanabilirim hem de bu işi kendi yararıma kullanabilirim.
I asked Fritz and Matthew for help with frightening the villagers. Of course, they jumped at the chance of making some mischief.
Köylüleri korkutma konusunda Fritz ve Matthew'dan yardım istedim. Tabi onlar da sorun yaratma şansını kaçırmadılar.

I asked the gossip about this fearless fellow. His name is Felix, and he might not be such a hero after all, especially at night by Lev's grave, on his own. Only he always has two cronies with him wherever he goes. But now I know what those two are afraid of...

Dedikoducu kadına korkusuz arkadaşı sordum. Adamın adı Felix ve hiç de öyle kahraman biri olmayabilirmiş, özellikle de gece Lev'in mezarında, tek başına. Tek sorun nereye giderse gitsin yanında olan iki arkadaşı varmış ama onların neden korktuklarını da öğrendim.

The charlatan won't be satisfied until every last one of the villagers is frightened, including one last brave lad, who claims he'd even sleep by Lev's grave. If I could get him there, maybe he wouldn't be so brave, if we only knew what would scare him. The gossip might know...

Şarlatan köydeki son kişi de korkana kadar tatmin olmayacak. Buna isterse Lev'in mezarında uyuyabileceğini söyleyen genç de dahil. Belki dediğini sahiden yapmasını sağlarsam o kadar da cesur olmadığı ortaya çıkar. Sadece onu neyin korkuttuğunu bulmam lazım. Dedikoducu kadın biliyor olabilir.
I told the charlatan what I know about Fearless Felix and his two companions. He wants me to deal with frightening that pair.
Şarlatana Korkusuz Felix ve iki arkadaşı hakkında öğrendiklerimi anlattım. Benim o ikiliyi korkutma işini halletmemi istiyor.
I must go back to the charlatan and tell him what I found out about those fearless fellows.
Şarlatanın yanına dön ve korkusuz kafadarlarla ilgili öğrendiklerini anlat.
The charlatan drew my attention to a certain dog with a terrifying bark that can be heard all over Ledetchko.
Şarlatan bana sesi bütün Ledetchko'dan duyulan garip bir havlaması olan bir köpekten bahsetti.

I remembered that the Rattay Huntsman is good at animal calls. Who could forget his blood-curdling nightingale screeching? So I went and talked to him and sure enough he came through. Now I'll just have to try not to get gored by a rival rutting stag!

Rattay Avcı Ustasının hayvan seslerini iyi bildiğini hatırladım. Onun o insanın kanını donduran bülbül sesini kim unutabilir ki? Ben de gidip onunla konuştum ve o da bana yardım etmeyi kabul etti. Şimdi tek yapmam gereken kızgın bir geyik tarafından boynuzlanmamak.
I could always try a more direct approach and just knock the fearless fellow out. Of course, it won't be easy, and if I get caught, the game will be up.
Daha doprudan bir yol izleyip korkusuz arkadaşı bayıltmayı deneyebilirim. Kolay olmayacak ve olur da yakalanırsam bütün foya ortaya çıkar.

An oil lamp - that's the charlatan's ingenious plan. All I have to do is shoot it down from a branch over the grave, it will break in the grave and the oil will burst into flames. That could work alright, just as long as my aim is good enough.

Yağ lambası. Şarlatanın dahice planı. Tek yapmam gereken önceden mezarın üzerindeki bir dala asmak ve sonra vurduğumda da içindeki yağ dağılıp alev alacak. Benim okçuluğumdan yana bir sorun olmadığı sürece plan işe yarayacaktır.
I'm very curious what twisted plan the charlatan will come up with for frightening the other two.
Şarlatanın diğer ikisini nasıl korkutmayı planlaığını çok merak ediyorum.
That didn't take much doing. He was clearly reluctant, but he didn't want to look like a coward and a blowhard.
Çok da zor olmadı. Gönülsüz olduğu açıktı ama herkesin önünde korkak bir palavracı olduğu ortaya çıksın istemedi.
Now to provoke Fearless Felix into spending the night at the grave.
Şimdi sıra Korkusuz Felix'I geceyi mezarda tek başına geçirmeye ikna etmekte.
My aim was true! The lamp fell into the grave and broke. If it had been lit, the whole thing would have gone up in flames.
Atışım mükemmeldi! Lamba mezara düştü ve kırıldı. Başarılı olamasaydım bütün emeklerim boşa düşecekti.
I didn't get round to practicing shooting down the lamp. I'll just have to hope my aim is good enough when the time comes.
Lambayı vurma alıştırması yapmak için ağacın oraya gitmedim. Zamanı geldiğinde lambayı vurabilmeyi ummaktan başka yapacak bir şeyim yok.
The charlatan said I can practice trying to shoot down the oil lamp.
Şarlatan ağaçtaki lambayı vurmak için alıştırma yapabileceğimi söyledi.
Those two got the fright of their lives. They won't forget this night in a hurry!
O ikisi ömürleri boyunca yetecek kadar korktular. Olanları kolay kolay unutmazlar!

I have to frighten Felix's two companions. Fire should scare one and wild animal calls the other. If all else fails, I can always knock the two of them out. The important thing is that Fearless Felix is left there on his own.
Felix'in arkadaşlarını korkutmam gerek. Biri için ateş diğeri için de vahşi hayvan sesleri. Bunlar işe yaramazsa onları hayıltabilirim. Önemli olan şey korkusuz Felix'in mezarda tek kalması.
The fearless fellows have been dealt with. Now I just have to talk to the charlatan.
Korkusuz adamların icabına bakıldı. Geriye şarlatanla konuşmak kaldı sadece.

The charlatan was clearly delighted with the outcome. His plan worked and the locals are buying up anything they can to ward of evil. He'll soon have enough money to be on his way. And I got a well-earned reward.

Şarlatanın sonuçtan memnun kaldığı aşikar. Planı işe yaradı ve köylüler şarlatanın şeytan kovar dediği ne varsa alıyorlar. Yakında tekrar yola düşecek kadar para kazanmış olur ve ben de hak ettiğim ödülümü aldım.
I have to come in the morning for my reward. Then the charlatan will know if his plan has worked.
Sabah olunca gidip ödülümü almam gerek. O zamana kadar da şarlatan planın işe yarayıp yaramadığını anlamış olur.
I escorted Adela to Sasau, where she can start a new life.
I escorted Adela to Sasau, where she can start a new life.
Now I should escort Adela to Sasau to start a new life.
Now I should escort Adela to Sasau to start a new life.
This siege will never make any progress unless I help Master Feyfar.
Üstat Feyfar'a yardım etmediğim sürece bu kuşatma ilerleme kaydetmeyecek.
I managed to talk the Ledetchko miller into giving Fritz and Matthew a chance. I hope those two ne'er-do-wells don't make me look like a fool.
Ledetchko değirmencisiyle Fritz'e ve Matthew'a bir şans vermesi adına konuştum. Umarım şu bir baltaya sap olmaz herifler yüzümü kara çıkarmazlar.
I persuaded the Ledetchko miller to give Fritz and Matthew a chance. I must go and tell them right away.
Ledetchko değirmencisini Fritz'e ve Matthew'a bir şans vermesi için ikna ettim. Hemen gidip bunu onlara söylemeliyim.
I persuaded the itinerants to leave. The Bailiff was happy and rewarded me well.
Gezginleri gitmeleri için ikna ettim. Başmuhafız işimden memnun kaldı ve bana iyi bir ödül verdi.
There was no persuading the itinerants and things got a little out of hand. They're all dead... Well, they left me with no option. Of course, the Bailiff wasn't too happy about it.
Gezginleri ikna etmenin yolu yoktu ve işler biraz kontrolden çıktı.
The itinerants are dead, but I still managed to take advantage of the fact by blaming the revenant for their deaths. And the Bailiff was convinced.
Gezginler öldü ama onları öldüren hortlakmış gibi göstererek yine durumdan karlı çıktım. Başmuhafız da duruma inandı.
Those itinerants don't care much for work, but they're not stupid. I talked them into helping me out with haunting the villagers.
Gezginler pek iş arayan tipler değiller ama salak da değiller. Köyün başına musallat olma konusunda bana yardım etmeleri için onları ikna ettim.
I got them out of the way. Forever. I had to do it, or they'd have betrayed us.
Felix ve arkadaşlarının icaplarına baktım. Sonsuza kadar. Yapmasam işimize çomak sokacaklardı.
I let them go. So now everyone in Ledetchko will know about me. I'll have to break the bad news to the charlatan.
Felix ve arkadaşlarının gitmelerine izin verdim. Artık Ledetchko'daki herkes yaptıklarımı bilecek. Şarlatana kötü haberi vermem lazım.

Things got out of hand. I wasn't cautious enough and Felix and his companions caught me red-handed. Now they're on the way back to Ledetchko to tell everyone about me. I could stop them, but only by violent means. Is it worth it though?

İşler çığırından çıktı. Yeteri kadar dikkatli değildim ve Felix ve arkadaşları beni yakaladılar. Şimdi Ledetchko'ya dönüyorlar ve herkese bu işlerin arkasındakinin ben olduğumu anlatacaklar. Onları durdurabilirim tabi ama bu da ancak şiddet yoluyla olur. Acaba bütün bunlara değer mi?
I didn't succeed. They caught me out and went home. What do I do now? I'd better let the charlatan know.
Başarısız oldum. Beni yakaladılar ve eve döndüler. Şimdi ne yapacağım? Şarlatana haber versem iyi olacak.
I went to see Theresa. She was happy to hear from Fritz and Matthew and she even advised me which mill to ask at for jobs for them.
Theresa'yı görmeye gittim. Fritz'den ve Matthew'dan haber aldığına sevindi, hatta onlara iş bulmak için hangi değirmenlere sormam gerektiğine dair tavsiyelerde bulundu.
I promised Fritz and Matthew I'd pass on their regards to Theresa when I meet her.
Fritz'e ve Matthew'a, Theresa'yla görüştüğümde selamlarını ileteceğime dair söz verdim.
I promised Pa I'd go and talk to Stibor about the silver going missing from the mines. Stibor was quite startled and asked for my help. It seems it was the pair of them who were responsible!
I promised Pa I'd go and talk to Stibor about the silver going missing from the mines. Stibor was quite startled and asked for my help. It seems it was the pair of them who were responsible!
I promised Pa I'd go and talk to Stibor about the silver going missing from the mines. Pa said Stibor would know what it was about.
I promised Pa I'd go and talk to Stibor about the silver going missing from the mines. Pa said Stibor would know what it was about.

I was getting tired of riding around the countryside and wishing something would happen to break the monotony. And eventually something did - unfortunately. A little past Merhojed we saw smoke rising on the horizon. Kuno ordered the band to ride forward, and soon we arrived at the smouldering remains of a farmstead.

Kırsalda bir oraya bir buraya at sürmekten sıkılmıştım ve monotonluktan çıkmak için bir şeyler olmasını diliyordum. Ve - ne yazık ki - bir şeyler oldu. Merjohed'i geçtikten bir süre sonra, ufukta yükselen dumarlar gördük. Kuno çeteye hemen oraya varmaları için emir verdi, ve en sonunda oraya vardığımızda, bir çiftliğin külleri ile karşılaştık.
Riding around the countryside constantly is tiring and seemingly unending, but I have to stick with Kuno's band, otherwise I'll be in trouble not only with Sir Radzig, but with Kuno too.
Kırsalda durmaksızın at sürmek yorucu ve bitmeyecekmiş gibi geliyor, ama Kuno'nun çetesinden ayrılmamalıyım, aksi taktirde sadece Sör Radzig'le değil Kuno ile de başım derde girer.

It was necessary to search the burnt-out farm thoroughly. I didn't expect to find much in the way of clues in the ruins, so I was quite surprised to come across an armorial shield with a message attached to it in one of the buildings.

Yanmış çiftliği en ince ayrıntısına kadar araştırmam gerekiyordu. Yıkıntılar arasında fazla bir ipucu bulabileceğimi sanmıyordum, bunun için yanmış binaların birinin içinde üstüne bir not iliştirilmiş hanedan armalı bir kalkan bulduğumda oldukça şaşırdım.
I must scout out the burnt-out farm and see if there are any traces left of the raiders.
Yanmış çiftliği araştırmam ve yağmacıların iz bırakıp bırakmadığını bulmam lazım.

Since the raiders couldn't have got far, I got to work trying to track them. It wasn't too difficult, since there were quite a few of them and they were loaded down with loot. I managed to track them to a clearing not far from the farm, where they were having a rest before moving on.

Saldırganlar çok uzaklaşmış olmadıkları için, onların izlerini bulmaya çalışmalıydım. Oldukça fazla oldukları için, bu çok da zor olmadı. Onların izini, devam etmeden önce mola verdikleri ve çiftlikten çok da uzakta olmayan bir açıklığa kadar sürebildim.

I ought to have a look around in the vicinity of the farm and see if I can find any traces left by the raiders, because they can't have got very far yet. Fletching seems to know what he's doing as far as scouting is concerned. I could have a word with him.

Çitfliğin etrafını da araştırıp, saldırganlardan herhangi bir iz kalıp kalmadığını öğrenmem lazımdı, çünkü henüz çok uzağa gitmiş olamazlardı. Gözlemcilik söz konusu olduğunda, Fletching oldukça tecrübeli görünüyor. Onla biraz sohbet edebilirim.

I told Kuno about the message I found at the farm and he immediately recognised the crest - the coat of arms of the House of Zoul, a dangerous band in his opinion. Why they should be pillaging here in the province was a mystery to him though.

Kuno'ya çiftlikte bulduğum mesaj hakkında bilgi verdim ve kabartıyı anında tanıdı - Zoul Hanedan Arması, ona göre ise oldukça tehlikeli bir çete. Ama neden bu bölgede yağma yaptıkları onun için tam bir muamma oldu.
I should tell Kuno about the message I found. He'll know what to do next.
Bulduğum mesaj hakkında Kuno'ya bilgi vermeliyim. Ne yapmamız gerektiğini bilir.
I tracked down the raiders. Their foul deeds shouldn't go unpunished and I'm sure Kuno will gladly help see to that.
Yağmacıların izini sürdüm. Yaptıkları haince şey yanlarına kalmamalıydı ve eminim ki Kuno bu konuda gerekeni yapacaktır.

I headed straight back to Rattay to report to Sir Radzig, who naturally was none to happy to hear the news I brought. It seems the House of Zoul, whose men raided the farm, have been engaged in a long-running feud with Sir Radzig and are out for vengeance. In his letter, Hagen Zoul even challenged Sir Radzig to a duel, but Sir Radzig would rather avoid that. I have to do something to stop the Zouls' campaign of provocation.

Doğruca Rattay'a gidip Sör Radzig'e olayları anlattım ve doğal olarak duyduğu şeylerden hiç hoşlanmadı. Görünüşe göre, çiftliği yağmalayan Zoul Hanesi uzun bir süredir Sör Radzig ile anlaşmazlık içinde ve bu yağmayı da intikam için yapmışlar. Mektupta, Hagen Zoul Sör Radzig'i bir düelloya bile davet etmişti, ama Sör Radzig buna pek yanaşmadı. Zoul'un provokasyon çabasını durdurmak için bir şeyler yapmalıydım.
I must report to Sir Radzig.
Follow Kuno and help him to eliminate the raiders.
Kuno'yu takip et ve yağmacıları yoketmesine yardım et.
It seems a shield was found at the farm with the coat of arms of the House of Zoul and a message addressed to Sir Radzig, which bodes nothing good.
Çiftlikte Zoul Hanesi'nin armasının olduğu bir kalkan ve Sör Radzig'i hedef alan bir mesaj bulunmuş, ki bu hiç hoş bir durum gibi görünmüyor.
Somehow I lost track of time. I must ask Kuno how things turned out at the farm.
Zamanın nasıl geçtiğinin farkına bile varmamışım. Kuno'ya çiftlikte neler olduğunu sormalıyım.
Some thugs started making trouble for Johanka, kicking around the gifts people brought her and spreading offensive talk about her. I made sure they stopped and left her alone.
Some thugs started making trouble for Johanka, kicking around the gifts people brought her and spreading offensive talk about her. I made sure they stopped and left her alone.
Some thugs have been making trouble for Johanka. I should sort them out. I can probably find them hanging around the monastery gate during the day.
Some thugs have been making trouble for Johanka. I should sort them out. I can probably find them hanging around the monastery gate during the day.
I should tell Johanka those thugs have been dealt with. She'll surely be glad to hear it.
I should tell Johanka those thugs have been dealt with. She'll surely be glad to hear it.

On the way we came across a girl who had fled from a nearby mill. She told us Hagen's men were pillaging there and feasting on the mill's supplies. So we attacked and dealt appropriately with the voracious rabble.

Yolda, yakındaki bir çiftlikten kaçmış bir kız ile karşılaştık. Bize, Hagen'in adamlarının orayı yağmaladığını ve değirmendeki erzaklar ile ziyafet çektiklerini söyledi. Böylece oraya saldırdık ve obur ayak takımının icabına baktık.
Hagen's band of brigands has taken over the windmill near Uzhitz and must be driven out!
Hagen'in eşkıya çetesi Uzhitz yakınlarındaki bir değirmeni ele geçirmiş ve onların oradan çıkarılması gerekiyor!

It's a good thing Josef is so popular in the area. Persuading the herb woman to brew a potion for him was child's play. I didn't even have to use the most extreme torture on her. In the end I succeeded in getting all the ingredients for the potion.

It's a good thing Josef is so popular in the area. Persuading the herb woman to brew a potion for him was child's play. I didn't even have to use the most extreme torture on her. In the end I succeeded in getting all the ingredients for the potion.

It's a good thing Josef is so popular in the area. Persuading the herb woman to brew a potion for him was child's play. I didn't even have to use the most extreme torture on her. Only I had to get some ingredients for the potion: five pieces of charcoal, five thistles and five handfuls of nettles.

It's a good thing Josef is so popular in the area. Persuading the herb woman to brew a potion for him was child's play. I didn't even have to use the most extreme torture on her. Only I had to get some ingredients for the potion: five pieces of charcoal, five thistles and five handfuls of nettles.
It turned out it was all a trap. Hagen's men surrounded us at the ford and a bloody engagement ensued. We barely made it back to the eastern bank and took cover in the woods.
Bunun bir tuzak olduğu ortaya çıktı. Hagen'in adamları bizi nehrin sığ yerinde yakalayıp etrafımızı sardı ve kanlı bir mücadele oldu. Zar zor doğu kıyısına ulaştık ve ağaçların arasına saklandık.
We were ambushed, just as we were crossing the ford. This is no time for heroism, better to beat a hasty retreat.
Nehrin karşısına geçerken pusuya düşürüldük. Kahramanlık yapmanın zamanı değildi, çabuk bir şekilde geri çekilmek yapılabilecek en iyi şeydi.

My first task was to go to Sir Kuno's encampment on the hill between Rattay and Ledetchko. I was given a warm welcome and was introduced to the members of the merry band - at least those who were conscious. Then I met Sir Kuno himself, who was happy to have a guide, but had no intention of dragging any dead weight with him.

İlk görevim Rattay ve Ledetchko'nun arasındaki tepede bulunan Sör Kuno'nun karargahına gitmekti. Gayet sıcak bir şekilde karşılandım ve ekibin üyeleri ile tanıştırıldım - en azından ayık olanlarla. Sonra Sör Kuno'nun kendisi ile tanıştım; kendisi bir rehber gelmesinden oldukça memnun görünüyordu ama işe yaramaz bir insanı da yanında sürüklemek istemiyordu.
First I have to go to Sir Kuno's camp and report to him.
İlk olarak Sör Kuno'nu kampına gidip ona rapor vermeliyim.

I had to prove I could handle a weapon by duelling with Dangler. It was obvious right from the start that Kuno's men were no greenhorns, but in the end I showed I had what it took and Kuno accepted me into the company.
Dangler ile düello yaparak silah kullanabileceğimi kanıtlamak zorunda kaldım. Kuno'nun adamlarının birer acemi olmadığı apaçık ortadaydı, ama en sonunda başardım ve Kuno beni kabul etti.
To prove to Kuno that I know what I'm doing in combat, I have to duel with his man Dangler and put on a good show of skill.
Savaşta ne yaptığımı bildiğimi Kuno'ya kanıtlamak için, adamlarından biri olan Dangler ile düello yapmalı ve tüm hünerlerimi sergilemeliyim.
The first expedition with Kuno's band is ahead of me. The Chief wants to set off at first light.
Kuno'nun çetesi ile ilk görevim beni bekliyor. Kuno sabahın ilk ışıkları ile hareket etmek istiyor.
Kuno's band needs to keep patrolling, and me with them.
Kuno'nun çetesi benle birlikte devriye atmalı.
We have to keep up the patrols. Hagen's pillaging must be nipped in the bud.
Devriyeleri hazır tutmalıyız. Hagen'in yağmalarını en aza indirmemiz lazım.

It looks like Jakey betrayed Kuno. Apart from anything else, he was the one who brought us the information that unfamiliar horsemen had been seen, he went on ahead before we reached the ford and now he's nowhere to be seen.
Jakey Kuno'ya ihanet etmiş gibi görünüyor. Her şeyden önce, tanıdık olmayan atlıların görüldüğü bilgisini bize getiren oydu, biz sığlık yere ulaşmadan önce o önden gitmişti ve şu anda ortalıkta yok.
We'll have to figure out what to do next. I'd better hear what Kuno has to say.
Bundan sonra ne yapacağımıza karar vermemiz lazım. Kuno'nun bu konu hakkında ne düşündüğünü duymak iyi olacaktır.

Either Jakey didn't expect us to survive the ambush, or he hadn't the good sense to vanish while he had the chance. Instead he went to the Inn in the Glade to spend his thirty pieces of silver. By the time I got there, he was gone, and the people there weren't very forthcoming about where he went. It took a bit of persuasion, but in the end I found out he'd been drinking with some merchant's daughter called Maria and the two had then gone off together into the night.

Ya Jakey pusudan sağ çıkabileceğimizi düşünmedi, ya da fırsatı varken topuklayacak kadar sağduyulu değildi. Ortalardan kaybolmak yerine Kayran Hanı'na gidip otuz parça gümüşünü harcamaya başladı. Oraya varana kadar kendisi ayrılmıştı ve oradaki insanların onun nereye gittiğine dair pek fikri yoktu. Biraz ikna kabiliyeti gerektirdi ancak sonunda Maria adlı bir tüccar kızı ile içip geceleyin birlikte ayrıldıklarını öğrendim.

Either Jakey didn't expect us to survive the ambush, or he hadn't the good sense to vanish while he had the chance. Instead he went to the Inn in the Glade to spend his thirty pieces of silver. He's probably gone by now, but I should certainly go there and find out what I can.

Ya Jakey pusudan sağ çıkabileceğimizi düşünmedi, ya da fırsatı varken topuklayacak kadar sağduyulu değildi. Ortalardan kaybolmak yerine Kayran Hanı'na gidip otuz parça gümüşünü harcamaya başladı. Şimdiye kadar gitmiştir ancak yine de gidip neler yapabileceğime bakmalıyım.

Some of the people at the Inn had seen Jakey and Maria running to the pine forest to the south of there. I started looking for them there. Clearly they were both full of drunken cheer and had left behind quite a trail.
Handaki insanların bazıları Maria ve Jakey'i güneydeki çam ormanlığına giderken görmüşler. Onları orada aramaya başladım. Anlaşılan ikisi de epey sarhoşmuş ve arkalarında epey iz bırakmışlar.

Some of the people at the Inn saw Jakey and Maria running to the pine forest to the south of there. I should start looking for them there. Maria's father went looking for them too, so there's a chance I might run into him.
Handaki insanların bazıları Maria ve Jakey'i güneydeki çam ormanlığına giderken görmüşler. Onları aramaya oradan başlamalıyım. Maria'nın babası da onları arıyormuş, belki ona rastlarım.
After I'd heard Jakey's story about Maria, it was clear to me she wouldn't be going back to her father in a hurry. Apparently she didn't hold him in very high regard.
Jakey'nin Maria ile olan hikayesini dinledikten sonra, babasının yanına koşarak dönmeyeceğini anladım. Anlaşılan babasına çok saygı göstermiyormuş.

I ran into Maria's father, a merchant called Ernest, who's also looking for her, although he doesn't seem to be putting much effort into it. He's just standing at the edge of the woods and calling out to her. Anyway, I promised I'd help him find his daughter.

Maria'nın babası olan, Ernest adlı tüccara rastladım. O da kızını arıyormuş ancak bu konuda pek çaba sarf ediyor gibi gözükmüyor. Ormanın girişinde durup kızına sesleniyor sadece. Neyse, kızını bulacağıma dair ona söz verdim.
I found Jakey tied to a tree deep in the woods, which is rather convenient for interrogating him, which I should do now.
Jakey'yi ormanın derinliklerindeki ağaçlara bağlı halde buldum ki bu durum onu sorgulamak için biçilmiş kaftan. Sorgulamaya şimdi başlamalıyım gerçi.

We caught up with Hagen and his men in a field near Samopesh. Hagen wanted to parley with Kuno and offered him quite a pile of coin to leave the province and interfere no more. I intervened and reminded Kuno of his honour, albeit a mercenary's honour. Fortunately I convinced him and Hagen had no choice but to fight. It was a tough battle, but in the end we got the better of them.

We caught up with Hagen and his men in a field near Samopesh. Hagen wanted to parley with Kuno and offered him quite a pile of coin to leave the province and interfere no more. I intervened and reminded Kuno of his honour, albeit a mercenary's honour. Fortunately I convinced him and Hagen had no choice but to fight. It was a tough battle, but in the end we got the better of them.

We caught up with Hagen and his men in a field near Samopesh. Hagen wanted to parley with Kuno and offered him quite a pile of coin to leave the province and interfere no more. I intervened and reminded Kuno of his honour, albeit a mercenary's honour. Fortunately I convinced him and Hagen had no choice but to fight. It was a tough battle and one we couldn't win. I had to retreat from the battlefield to save my life.

We caught up with Hagen and his men in a field near Samopesh. Hagen wanted to parley with Kuno and offered him quite a pile of coin to leave the province and interfere no more. I intervened and reminded Kuno of his honour, albeit a mercenary's honour. Fortunately I convinced him and Hagen had no choice but to fight. It was a tough battle and one we couldn't win. I had to retreat from the battlefield to save my life.
We face Hagen and his men on the field of battle. They must be defeated!
We face Hagen and his men on the field of battle. They must be defeated!

We caught up with Hagen and his men in a field near Samopesh. Hagen wanted to parley with Kuno and offered him quite a pile of coin to leave the province and interfere no more. Kuno, unscrupulous mercenary that he is, took Hagen's money and rode away with his men. Hagen thought it was all over, but I appealed to his honour and challenged him to a duel, which I won in the name of my liege lord, Sir Radzig.

We caught up with Hagen and his men in a field near Samopesh. Hagen wanted to parley with Kuno and offered him quite a pile of coin to leave the province and interfere no more. Kuno, unscrupulous mercenary that he is, took Hagen's money and rode away with his men. Hagen thought it was all over, but I appealed to his honour and challenged him to a duel, which I won in the name of my liege lord, Sir Radzig.
