Kuno, unscrupulous mercenary that he is, took Hagen's money and rode away with his men. Hagen thought it was all over, but I appealed to his honour and challenged him to a duel. Unfortunately, I was no match for him and had to beat a tactical retreat.

We caught up with Hagen and his men in a field near Samopesh. Hagen wanted to parley with Kuno and offered him quite a pile of coin to leave the province and interfere no more. Kuno, unscrupulous mercenary that he is, took Hagen's money and rode away with his men. Hagen thought it was all over, but I appealed to his honour and challenged him to a duel. Unfortunately, I was no match for him and had to beat a tactical retreat.
I challenged Hagen Zoul to a duel! I must defeat him!
I challenged Hagen Zoul to a duel! I must defeat him!

There's not enough coin in the trunk to pay wages, so the artisans have put down their tools and the traders have closed shop. If the village is to start working again, there has to be enough coin there overnight.

Sandıkta maaşları ödeyecek kadar para yok, esnaflar bu yüzden aletlerini bıraktı, tüccarlar ise dükkanlarını kapattı. Eğer köy tekrar çalışmaya başlayacaksa bir geceliğine orada yeterli para olması gerek.
I suspect this so-called Musk of Infinite Allure will attract nothing but flies. But Sir Hans was very happy with it and went at once to prepare for his rendezvous. Bon courage!
Bence bu sözde Sonsuz Cazibe İksiri anca sinekleri tavlar ama Sör Hans tatmin oldu ve hemen buluşma için hazırlanmaya başladı. Bon courage!
I've got the potion for Sir Hans. Now to deliver it to him, so he can embark on his amorous adventure in proper French style.
İksiri Sör Hans için aldım. O da böylece bu aşk macerasına Fransız stilinde atılabilir.

The Virgin Mary appeared again to Johanka and she decided to go and preach again. This time she didn't want to preach on the square, but in a meadow outside of town. I accompanied her there and listened to her sermon. It sent shivers down my spine.

The Virgin Mary appeared again to Johanka and she decided to go and preach again. This time she didn't want to preach on the square, but in a meadow outside of town. I accompanied her there and listened to her sermon. It sent shivers down my spine.

The Virgin Mary appeared again to Johanka and she decided to go and preach again. This time she'd rather not preach on the square, but in a meadow outside of town. I should accompany her to make sure nothing happens to her. Anyway, I'm curious what she'll say this time.

The Virgin Mary appeared again to Johanka and she decided to go and preach again. This time she'd rather not preach on the square, but in a meadow outside of town. I should accompany her to make sure nothing happens to her. Anyway, I'm curious what she'll say this time.

The Virgin Mary appeared again to Johanka and she decided to go and preach again. This time she didn't want to preach on the square, but in a meadow outside of town. I accompanied her there and listened to her sermon. It sent shivers down my spine.

The Virgin Mary appeared again to Johanka and she decided to go and preach again. This time she didn't want to preach on the square, but in a meadow outside of town. I accompanied her there and listened to her sermon. It sent shivers down my spine.
Johanka wanted me to escort her, but I didn't make it. I'd better go and see her again.
Johanka wanted me to escort her, but I didn't make it. I'd better go and see her again.

The Virgin Mary appeared again to Johanka and she decided to go and preach again. This time she'd rather not preach on the square, but in a meadow outside of town. I should accompany her to make sure nothing happens to her and anyway, I'm curious what she'll say this time. I should pick her up at dawn and I'd better not be late.

The Virgin Mary appeared again to Johanka and she decided to go and preach again. This time she'd rather not preach on the square, but in a meadow outside of town. I should accompany her to make sure nothing happens to her and anyway, I'm curious what she'll say this time. I should pick her up at dawn and I'd better not be late.

The Virgin Mary appeared again to Johanka and she decided to go and preach again. This time she didn't want to preach on the square, but in a meadow outside of town. I accompanied her there and listened to her sermon. It sent shivers down my spine.

The Virgin Mary appeared again to Johanka and she decided to go and preach again. This time she didn't want to preach on the square, but in a meadow outside of town. I accompanied her there and listened to her sermon. It sent shivers down my spine.

The Virgin Mary appeared again to Johanka and she decided to go and preach again. This time she didn't want to preach on the square, but in a meadow outside of town. She wanted me to escort her and she wasn't at all happy when I turned up late. She'll be waiting for me at dawn again and this time I'd better not let her down.

The Virgin Mary appeared again to Johanka and she decided to go and preach again. This time she didn't want to preach on the square, but in a meadow outside of town. She wanted me to escort her and she wasn't at all happy when I turned up late. She'll be waiting for me at dawn again and this time I'd better not let her down.
I'd better get back to the Bailiff quickly and let him know how I got on.
Hemen Başmuhafızın yanına dönüp neler olduğunu anlatmalıyım.
If I'd know what trials I'd have to endure to get Sir Hans' necklace back, I'd have told him politely to find himself some other lackey. But at least he was truly delighted to have it back.
Eğer Sör Hans'ın kolyesini geri almak için başıma gelecekleri bilseydim, bu iş için başka bir salak bulmasını söylerdim. En azından kolyeryi geri aldığı için gerçekten mutlu olduç
I've got the necklace at last! Now to get it to Sir Hans.
Sonunda kolyeyi aldım! Şimdi sıra sör Hans'a götürmekte.

While Sir Hans went up to Karolina's room to "claim his prize", I had to keep her father busy and above all make sure he didn't catch Sir Hans with his hose around his ankles, otherwise there'd be hell to pay!
Sör Hans Karoline'nın odasında "ödülünü alırken" benim de kızın babasını meşguş etmem ve daha da önemlisi onu donu inik bir vaziyette yakalamamasını sağlama gerek yoksa ortalık fena karışır!
I couldn't keep the butcher at bay long enough. It seems the art of conversation isn't his strongest point. Or mine.
Kasabı yeterince uzun süre meşgul edemedim. Görünen o ki muhabbet sanatı ne onun ne de benim iyi olduğumuz bir şeymiş.
Sir Hans went up to Karolina's and left me outside to keep watch and buy him enough time to finish what he started without interruption.
Sör Hans Karolina'nın yanına gitti ve beni de bekçilik edip ona işini bitirmesi için yeterince zaman kazanmam için dışarıda bıraktı.
The Marigold decoction did the trick - Sir Hans' rash has cleared up. We can go a-courting!
Çuha çiçeği özü işe yaradı. Sör Hans'ın kızarıklıkları geçti. Artık kur yapmaya gidebiliriz.
By the time I managed to get hold of the Marigold decoction, Sir Hans' rash had already cleared up on its own.
Ben Çuha çiçeği özünü bulana kadar Sör Hans'ın kızarıklıkları kendiliğinden geçmişti bile.
When Karolina's father, the butcher, pounced on me in front of their house, I decided the best course of action was to run for my life. Sir Hans won't be too pleased about it...
Karolina'nın babası, kasap, evin önünde beni yakalayınca yapacak en iyi şeyin kaçmak olduğuna kadar verdim. Bu durum Sör Hans'ın hiç hoşuna gitmeyecek.
I'm supposed to be keeping watch at the butcher's house. I'd better get back there, or Sir Hans might get caught.
Kasabın evinin önünde bekçilik etmem gerekli. Oraya dönsem iyi olacak yoksa Sör Hans yakalanabilir.
I'm amazed! Johanka spoke like she was completely transformed. Like a real prophet! I really didn't expect that of her. And I'd say she made quite an impression on her listeners.
I'm amazed! Johanka spoke like she was completely transformed. Like a real prophet! I really didn't expect that of her. And I'd say she made quite an impression on her listeners.
Johanka set off in the morning to the market square to share her visions with the people. I wasn't there for it, so I should go and ask her how it went.
Johanka set off in the morning to the market square to share her visions with the people. I wasn't there for it, so I should go and ask her how it went.
Johanka is planning to share the Virgin Mary's message with the people. I ought to offer her a few words of encouragement.
Johanka is planning to share the Virgin Mary's message with the people. I ought to offer her a few words of encouragement.
I picked up the raiders' trail at the edge of the woods. I should follow it and see where it leads me.
Yağmacıların izini ormanın sonuna kadar sürdüm. İzlerin beni nereye götüreceğini bulmak içini, izleri takip etmeye devam etmeliyim.
I picked up the raiders' trail at the edge of the woods. I should follow it and see where it leads me.
Yağmacıların izini ormanın sonuna kadar sürdüm. İzlerin beni nereye götüreceğini bulmak içini, izleri takip etmeye devam etmeliyim.
I picked up the raiders' trail at the edge of the woods. I should follow it and see where it leads me.
Yağmacıların izini ormanın sonuna kadar sürdüm. İzlerin beni nereye götüreceğini bulmak içini, izleri takip etmeye devam etmeliyim.
I picked up the raiders' trail at the edge of the woods. I should follow it and see where it leads me.
Yağmacıların izini ormanın sonuna kadar sürdüm. İzlerin beni nereye götüreceğini bulmak içini, izleri takip etmeye devam etmeliyim.
I talked to Stibor about what to do next. It turns out the best option is if I go into the mine to get the silver.
I talked to Stibor about what to do next. It turns out the best option is if I go into the mine to get the silver.
I have to talk to Stibor about what to do next.
I have to talk to Stibor about what to do next.

I finally got the gossip to tell me how Lev ended up, and it's no wonder she was reluctant to talk about it. When some arsonist was starting fires in Ledetchko, the villagers were sure Lev was the culprit and set fire to his house with him inside! But the fires didn't stop, so he was innocent...

Sonunda dedikoducuyu Lev'in hikayesinin sonunu anlatması konusunda ikna ettim ve neden isteksiz olduğunu anlayabiliyorum. Bazı kundakçılar Ledetchko'da etrafı kundaklamaya başladıkları zaman köylüler sorumlunun Lev olduğuna eminlermiş ve Lev içindeyken onun evini yakmışlar! Ancak kundaklamalar son bulmamış, yani Lev masummuş.
The gossip refuses to talk to me anymore. She's very sensitive about the whole affair and I must have pressed her too much. Now I'll never know how things ended up with Lev.
Dedikoducu kadın benimle artık konuşmuyor. Kadın bütün olanlar konusunda bayağı bir hassas ve görünüşe göre ben de çok üzerine gittim. Artık Lev'in başına en son neler geldiğini öğrenemeyeceğim.
I should ask the gossip about a good place to bury Lev's remains. Without letting on what I'm up to, of course...
Lev'in kalıntılarını nereye gömebileceğimi dedikoducuya sormalıyım. Tabi neyin peşinde olduğumu anlamamalı.

I've got to get back Sir Hans' necklace, which he lost at dice in Ledetchko before realising it was just the thing to help him win the hand of the "love of his life". Naturally, any task for Capon would have to be as complicated as possible. The man who won it from him lost it to another player, some nobleman travelling to Sasau...

Sör Hans'ın "hayatının aşkı"nın kalbini (ve başka yerlerini) kazanmasını sağlayacak olan şey olduğunu fark etmeden önce Ledetchko'da zar oynarken kaybettiği kolyesini geri almalıyım. Tabi Capon'un vereceği görevler doğaları gereği olabildikleri kadar karmaşık olmalılar. Capon'u kumarda yenen adam kolyeyi Sasau'ya seyahat eden başka bir soyluya kaptırmış.

I've got to get back Sir Hans' necklace, which he lost at dice in Ledetchko. Naturally, no task for Capon would be simple. The man who won it from him lost it to another player, some nobleman travelling to Sasau. And as if that weren't enough, this nobleman was murdered and robbed and the necklace ended up in the camp of a robber baron!

Sör Capon'un Ledetchko'da zar oynarken kaybettiği zarı geri almam gerek. Tabi Capon'un verdiği görevlerin hangisi basit olur ki? Capon'u kumarda yenen adam kolyeyi Sasau'ya giden bir asilzadeye kaptırmış. Bu da yetmezmiş gibi bu asilzade yolda soyulup öldürülmüş ve kolye şu anda haydut bir baronun kampında!
I know the murderer stole Sir Alphonse's dice. And apparently they're not easy to overlook - they were made specially, are red and gold and one of them has a devil's head in place of the one.

Katilin Sör Alphonse'nun zarlarını çaldığını biliyorum. İnsanın gözünden kaçacak tipte şeyler değillermiş. Özel olarak imal edilmişler ve kırmızı ve altın rengindelermiş. Bir tanesinin üzerinde de bir yerine şeytan kafası varmış.
I told Sir Anselm that Sir Alphonse was robbed and killed by the fellow they call Noggin.
Sör Anselm'e Sör Alphonse'nun Noggin adında biri tarafından öldürülüp soyulduğunu söyledim.
I told Sir Anselm that Sir Alphonse was robbed and killed by the fellow they call Berta.
Sör Anselm'e Sör Alphonse'nun Berta adında biri tarafından öldürülüp soyulduğunu söyledim.
I told Sir Anselm that Sir Alphonse was robbed and killed someone called Pechuna.
Sör Anselm'e Sör Alphonse'nun Pechuna adında biri tarafından öldürülüp soyulduğunu söyledim.
I told Sir Anselm that Sir Alphonse was robbed and killed by Sir Erhart himself.
Sör Anselm'e Sör Alphonse'nun bizzat Sör Erhart tarafından öldürülüp soyulduğunu söyledim.
I told Sir Anselm that Sir Alphonse was robbed and killed by someone called Mladota.
Sör Anselm'e Sör Alphonse'nun Mladota adında biri tarafından öldürülüp soyulduğunu söyledim.
I told Sir Anselm that Sir Alphonse was robbed and killed by the wench who hangs around at the robbers' camp.
Sör Anselm'e Sör Alphonse'nun haydutlarla beraber kampta takılan kız tarafından öldürülüp soyulduğunu söyledim.
I told Sir Anselm that Sir Alphonse was robbed and killed by old Blaha.
Sör Anselm'e Sör Alphonse'nun yaşlı Blaha tarafından öldürülüp soyulduğunu söyledim.
Bianca wanted me to come back to her after bringing the beer to Henry. I did what she asked and went back to see what else she wanted.
Bianca wanted me to come back to her after bringing the beer to Henry. I did what she asked and went back to see what else she wanted.
Bianca wanted me to come back to her after bringing the beer to Henry. I didn't go back to her though.
Bianca wanted me to come back to her after bringing the beer to Henry. I didn't go back to her though.
I took the beer as Bianca wanted, but she wants something else as well. I have to go and see her as soon as I can.
I took the beer as Bianca wanted, but she wants something else as well. I have to go and see her as soon as I can.
At least I know now of a good place to bury Lev's remains - in a meadow near Ledetchko, where he buried his wife and child. What better place for him to find rest at last?
Sonunda Lev'I gömebileceğim iyi bir yer biliyorum. Ledetchko yakınlarındaki bir çayır. Karısını ve çocuğunu oraya gömmüş. Daha çok huzur bilebileceği başka neresi olabilir ki?
I won the tournament and Blaha gave me the key to the chest containing my winnings, including one very elusive necklace.
Turnuvayı kazandım ve Blaha bana aralarında elimden kaçıp duran kolyenin de olduğu ödüllerin bulunduğu sandığın anahtarını verdi.
I won the dice tournament and all the prizes are mine! I have to go to Blaha for my winnings.
Turnuvayı kazandım ve ödüller benim oldu! Kazandıklarımı almak için Blaha'yı görmem gerek.
Blaha told me young Pechuna won the tournament, collected his winnings and left for Sasau to celebrate.
Blaha bana genç Pechuna'nın turnuvayı kazandığını ve ödüllerini alıp kutlama için Sasau'ya gittiğini söyledi.
However won the tournament has taken all the winnings, including the necklace. I'd better find out from old Blaha who it was.
Turnuvayı her kim kazandıysa ortaya konan her şeyi alıp gitmiş. Yaşlı Blaha'yı bulup kim olduğunu öğrenmem gerek.
I found Pechuna in Sasau and got Capon's necklace back from him. Thank Christ!
Pechuna'yı Sasau'daki handa buldum ve Capon'un kolyesini ondan aldım. İsa'ya şükürler olsun!
Pechuna the charcoal-burner won Capon's necklace. I'll have to try and get it from him before he sells it, loses it, or gets robbed! He'll be drinking at the tavern in Sasau.
Capon'un kolyesini kazanan kömürcü Pechuna olmuş. Kolyeyi satımadan, kaybetmeden ya da çaldırmadan önce onu bulmam gerek! Sasau'daki handa içiyor olmalı.

I didn't think the Custodian would just let Sir Erhart and his merry band go, but apparently that's what happened. Anyway, the encampment is cleared and there's nothing to stop me from going and getting the necklace.
Görevlinin Sör Erhart ve adamlarının gitmelerine izin vereceğini sanmıyordum ama görünen o ki vermiş. Neyse, kamp boşaldı ve gidip de kolyeyi almamı engelleyecek hiçbir şey kalmadı.
I managed to get my dice back, thank heavens! That little amorous adventure nearly cost me dear!
Zarlarımı geri almayı başardım. Tanrıya şükür! Bu aşk macerası az daha bana pahalıya mal olacaktı.
I only realised later that that light-fingered wench took my dice! I'd better catch her before she vanishes, otherwise I'll never see them again.
Sonradan fark ettim ki o yankesici orospu zarlarımı yürütmüş! Ortadan kaybolmadan önce onu yakalasam iyi olacak, yoksa zarlarımı bir daha asla göremem.
My guess paid off. I found Pechuna in the tavern, happily drinking away his dice winnings.
Tahminim doğru çıktı. Pechuna'yı zardan kazandıklarını handa harcarken buldum.
Someone must have won the dice tournament and left with the loot before Sir Erhart's merry band was routed. If it was someone local, he'll surely be drinking away his winnings in the nearest tavern.
Sör Erhart ve adamları kampı terk etmeden önce biri zar turnuvasını kazanıp kolyeyle beraber ayrılmış olmalı. Eğer yerlilerden biriyse mutlaka en yakın handa içkiye boğulmakla meşguldür.

Bianca wanted to pick some herbs to brew a special schnapps for Henry, but she was afraid to go into the woods alone, because someone saw a wolf there. I promised to accompany her, in the belief that there's safety in numbers.

Bianca wanted to pick some herbs to brew a special schnapps for Henry, but she was afraid to go into the woods alone, because someone saw a wolf there. I promised to accompany her, in the belief that there's safety in numbers.

Bianca wanted to pick some herbs to brew a special schnapps for Henry, but she was afraid to go into the woods alone, because someone saw a wolf there. I promised to accompany her, but in the end I left her on her own.

Bianca wanted to pick some herbs to brew a special schnapps for Henry, but she was afraid to go into the woods alone, because someone saw a wolf there. I promised to accompany her, but in the end I left her on her own.
Together we don't have to fear the wolf, so I promised to accompany Bianca. We're to meet near the bridge.
Together we don't have to fear the wolf, so I promised to accompany Bianca. We're to meet near the bridge.
I talked to Papa, and he wants me to run quite a few errands this morning.
I talked to Papa, and he wants me to run quite a few errands this morning.
Papa is up and about. I should ask him if he needs anything.
Papa is up and about. I should ask him if he needs anything.
I found the sack of stolen silver in the flooded mineshaft.
I found the sack of stolen silver in the flooded mineshaft.
Now it's all up to me. I have to find the stolen sack of silver without getting caught.
Now it's all up to me. I have to find the stolen sack of silver without getting caught.
The battle is over. Now it's time to report back to Sir Radzig.
The battle is over. Now it's time to report back to Sir Radzig.
I must find out how things ended up with Hagen.
I must find out how things ended up with Hagen.
I talked to Father. The business with Tobias Feyfar will work itself out somehow, but now I have other things to deal with.
I talked to Father. The business with Tobias Feyfar will work itself out somehow, but now I have other things to deal with.
I should talk to Father about last night. He won't be happy that I didn't go to see Master Feyfar.
I should talk to Father about last night. He won't be happy that I didn't go to see Master Feyfar.
Pa sent me to get the nails and I finally picked them up at the blacksmith's.
Pa sent me to get the nails and I finally picked them up at the blacksmith's.
The blacksmith didn't have the nails done for Pa yesterday. He was busy forging a sword for Sir Radzig. He should have them today though.
The blacksmith didn't have the nails done for Pa yesterday. He was busy forging a sword for Sir Radzig. He should have them today though.
Samuel is in the mines. I ran into Fritz and Matthew and they led me to him.
Samuel is in the mines. I ran into Fritz and Matthew and they led me to him.
I must find Samuel! He's working at the mines, but I don't know which gallery he's in today and besides, he could have fled to any of them. I have to find him and save him!
I must find Samuel! He's working at the mines, but I don't know which gallery he's in today and besides, he could have fled to any of them. I have to find him and save him!
I went back to Sir Hans. He gave me another chance, so we'll go to Karolina's again.
Sör Hans'ın yanına gittim. Bana bir şans daha verdi. Yine Karolina'ya gideceğiz.
I dallied too much while following Sir Hans to Karolina's and lost him. His Young Lordship certainly won't be happy about it. I should get back to him, or all my efforts will have been for nothing.
Sör Hans'I Karolina'nın evine takip ederken çok oyalandım ve onu kaybettim. Genç lort kesinlikle bu işten hoşlanmayacak. Onun yanına dönmem lazım yoksa tüm yaptıklarım boşa gidecek.
If I'm to find this cave, I'll have to start where Johanka said. I must find the footbridge beneath Skalitz Castle that leads to the waterworks next to the woods.
If I'm to find this cave, I'll have to start where Johanka said. I must find the footbridge beneath Skalitz Castle that leads to the waterworks next to the woods.

I went to the place Johanka described from her dream and found the cave, or rather an abandoned mineshaft near the woods. At the end of it I met with a terrible sight - corpses, lots of them, decomposing.

I went to the place Johanka described from her dream and found the cave, or rather an abandoned mineshaft near the woods. At the end of it I met with a terrible sight - corpses, lots of them, decomposing.
I went to the place Johanka described from her dream and found the cave, or rather an abandoned mineshaft near the woods. Now to look inside...
I went to the place Johanka described from her dream and found the cave, or rather an abandoned mineshaft near the woods. Now to look inside...
The corpses fell down the shaft from above. I found a bloody trail at the mouth of the shaft that led to nearby huts.
The corpses fell down the shaft from above. I found a bloody trail at the mouth of the shaft that led to nearby huts.

These corpses didn't get here on their own. Maybe someone carried them in here, although it's more likely they fell down the shaft, or rather were pushed. I should go and see where it opens out above.

These corpses didn't get here on their own. Maybe someone carried them in here, although it's more likely they fell down the shaft, or rather were pushed. I should go and see where it opens out above.
Tinker is used to getting fed in the morning. I gave him a nice treat.
Tinker is used to getting fed in the morning. I gave him a nice treat.
Tinker is used to getting fed in the morning. But he'll have to wait a while.
Tinker is used to getting fed in the morning. But he'll have to wait a while.
Tinker is used to getting fed in the morning. I should give him something.
Tinker is used to getting fed in the morning. I should give him something.
After a little persuasion, Bianca's brother, Adam, lent me his bow and a few arrows.
After a little persuasion, Bianca's brother, Adam, lent me his bow and a few arrows.
I didn't get the bow and arrows from Bianca's brother, Adam.
I didn't get the bow and arrows from Bianca's brother, Adam.
Bianca's brother, Adam, has a bow he could lend us, or rather me. Bianca says he likes me and I should easily convince him. Like his sister, he works at the tavern.
Bianca's brother, Adam, has a bow he could lend us, or rather me. Bianca says he likes me and I should easily convince him. Like his sister, he works at the tavern.
I went and parleyed with Sir Erhart and despite Sir Anselm's warnings, it turned out quite well. I doubt poor Alphonse could have managed any better, God rest his soul.
Gidip ve Sör Erhart'la konuştum ve Sör Anselm'in dediklerine rağmen hiç de kötü geçmedi. Tanrı ruhunu affetsin Sör Alphonse'nun bile bu kadar iyi iş çıkaracağını sanmam.
Sir Erhart will receive me now, but Sir Anselm warned me to avoid negotiating with him. I could easily betray myself if I say the wrong thing.
Sör Erhart şimdi beni kabul edecek ama Sör Anselm onunla pazarlık etmemem konusunda beni uyardı. Yanlış bir şey söylersem kendimi zor duruma düşürebilirim.

He thought it would help him out of a predicament. To convince Sir Hanush that he wasn't wasting time on frivolous pursuits, he told him he was training his page in knightly arts. His "page" meaning me, so what could I do but sign up for the tourney?

Onu bulunduğu kötü durumdan kurtulmasına yardımcı olacağını düşündü. Sör Hanush'u, önemsiz uğraşlarla vakit kaybetmediğine ikna etmek için, ona bir uşağını şövalyelik sanatında eğittiğini söylemiş. Buradaki "uşak" ben oluyorum. Şimdi gidip turnuvaya kaydolmaktan başka ne yapabilirim ki?

Sir Hans got himself into a bit of a fix with his uncle. To convince Sir Hanush that he wasn't wasting time on frivolous pursuits, he told him he was training his page in knightly arts. His "page" meaning me. So I told His Young Lordship I'd enrol to help him out, but I didn't do it.

Sör Hans, kendini amcasına karşı bir çıkmaza sokmuş. Sör Hanush'u, önemsiz uğraşlarla vakit kaybetmediğine ikna etmek için, ona bir uşağını şövalyelik sanatında eğittiğini söylemiş. Buradaki "uşak" ben oluyorum. Ben de genç Lort Hazretlerine ona turnuvaya katılarak yardımcı olacağımı söyledim ama bunu yapmadım.

Sir Hans got himself into a bit of a fix with his uncle. To convince Sir Hanush that he wasn't wasting time on frivolous pursuits, he told him he was training his page in knightly arts. His "page" meaning me, so what can I do but go and see the herald at the Upper Castle and sign up for the Rattay Tourney?

Sör Hans, kendini amcasına karşı bir çıkmaza sokmuş. Sör Hanush'u, önemsiz uğraşlarla vakit kaybetmediğine ikna etmek için, ona bir uşağını şövalyelik sanatında eğittiğini söylemiş. Buradaki "uşak" ben oluyorum. Peki şimdi Yukarı Kale'ye, haberciye gidip Rattay Turnuvası'na kaydolmaktan başka ne yapabilirim ki?
Now I should let Sir Hans know how I've fared as his page.
Şimdi gidip, Sör Hans'a uşağı olarak bu işin nasıl üstesinden geldiğimi söylemeliyim.
Bianca picked herbs while I kept my eyes peeled for the wolf.
Bianca picked herbs while I kept my eyes peeled for the wolf.
Bianca picked herbs while I kept a look out, but I didn't do a good job. I left her alone and went my own way.
Bianca picked herbs while I kept a look out, but I didn't do a good job. I left her alone and went my own way.
Bianca is picking herbs while I keep watch, because you never know where danger may be lurking.
Bianca is picking herbs while I keep watch, because you never know where danger may be lurking.
I found Bianca, who'd fled from the wolf. In exchange for my help, she offered to make some schnapps for me too. I should go and pick it up tomorrow.
I found Bianca, who'd fled from the wolf. In exchange for my help, she offered to make some schnapps for me too. I should go and pick it up tomorrow.
Bianca fled from the wolf and I didn't go looking for her. Hopefully she got away safely.
Bianca fled from the wolf and I didn't go looking for her. Hopefully she got away safely.
Bianca fled. I should go and find her now it's all over.
Bianca fled. I should go and find her now it's all over.
The wolf really did turn up... or rather a mangy old dog, but as hungry and mean-looking as any wolf. Fortunately it all ended well.
The wolf really did turn up... or rather a mangy old dog, but as hungry and mean-looking as any wolf. Fortunately it all ended well.
The wolf really did turn up... or rather a mangy old dog, but as hungry and mean-looking as any wolf. We had to run for our lives, but it all ended well.
The wolf really did turn up... or rather a mangy old dog, but as hungry and mean-looking as any wolf. We had to run for our lives, but it all ended well.
The wolf has attacked us! I have to drive him away somehow!
The wolf has attacked us! I have to drive him away somehow!
Sir Hans was far from pleased with me. Fortunately, it wasn't the last tourney - I could still enrol in another, which I did, saving His Young Lordship from his uncle's wrath.
Sör Hans benden hiç memnun kalmadı. En azından son turnuva değildi, ben de bir sonrakine kaydolabilirdim. Ben de böyle yaptım ve genç Lort Hazretlerini amcasının gazabından kurtardım.
Sir Hans was far from pleased with me. Fortunately, it's not the last tourney - I can enrol in the next one and still save His Young Lordship from his uncle's wrath.
Sör Hans benden hiç memnun kalmadı. En azından son turnuva değildi. Bir sonrakine katılıp, hâlâ genç Lort Hazretlerini amcasının gazabından kurtarabilirim.
Johanka is troubled by a recurring nightmare. I ought to ask her about it. After all, that's what friends are for.
Johanka is troubled by a recurring nightmare. I ought to ask her about it. After all, that's what friends are for.

Johanka was troubled by a recurring nightmare set in a particular place, so I went there and found there a dreadful murderer. After that was solved, Johanka stopped having the dream, but then she started having another, in which she was again visited by the Virgin Mary. Johanka's interpretation was that Our Lady wanted her to pass on a message to the people.

Johanka was troubled by a recurring nightmare set in a particular place, so I went there and found there a dreadful murderer. After that was solved, Johanka stopped having the dream, but then she started having another, in which she was again visited by the Virgin Mary. Johanka's interpretation was that Our Lady wanted her to pass on a message to the people.

Johanka is being troubled by a persistent nightmare set in a particular place. I promised her I'd go and try and find the locations she dreamt of. Maybe it will help her if I find out what's really there.

Johanka is being troubled by a persistent nightmare set in a particular place. I promised her I'd go and try and find the locations she dreamt of. Maybe it will help her if I find out what's really there.

When I told Sir Hans how I got on in the tourney, he said Sir Hanush had seen me there, so there was a good chance he'd get off his back and leave him to pursue his own interests. Such as hunting, drinking, whoring...

Sör Hans'a turnuvaya nasıl kaydolduğumu söylemeye gittiğimde, bana Sör Hanush'un beni orada gördüğünü ve yüksek ihtimalle kendi işleriyle uğraşması için onu rahat bıracağını söyledi. İşler de iş olsa; avlanmak, içmek, orospularla sikişmek…

Sir Hans was far from pleased with me. Fortunately, it wasn't the last tourney, so he told me to go and enrol in one of the upcoming ones. However, I didn't do that either and he gave me a right ear-bashing about it. I think it'll be a while before he cools down.

Sör Hans benden hiç memnun kalmadı. En azından son turnuva değildi, bana gidip bir sonraki turnuvaya kaydolmam gerektiğini söyledi. Ama ben bunu da yapmadım ve beni haklı bir şekilde azarladı. Sanırım sinirinin geçmesi için biraz zaman geçmesi gerekiyor.

Johanka asked me to find the place she sees in her nightmare. She described the way there that she walks in her dream - across a footbridge over a stream towards the waterworks next to the woods, with Skalitz Castle behind her. Then she goes past the waterworks to a rocky stream and follows it up to the mouth of the cave nearby.

Johanka asked me to find the place she sees in her nightmare. She described the way there that she walks in her dream - across a footbridge over a stream towards the waterworks next to the woods, with Skalitz Castle behind her. Then she goes past the waterworks to a rocky stream and follows it up to the mouth of the cave nearby.
I made sure that murderer met with the justice he deserved. His reign of terror is over.
I made sure that murderer met with the justice he deserved. His reign of terror is over.
I must put a stop to that murderer's exploits. Either I'll have to deal with him myself of tell Sir Radzig and let him deal with the matter.
I must put a stop to that murderer's exploits. Either I'll have to deal with him myself of tell Sir Radzig and let him deal with the matter.
I'm not sure how the two things are connected, but ever since I dealt with that murderer, Johanka's sleep has been free of that nightmare.
I'm not sure how the two things are connected, but ever since I dealt with that murderer, Johanka's sleep has been free of that nightmare.

My investigation has come to an end. I don't know what else I could look for around here. There was no devil, but evil there was in abundance. I should go and tell Johanka about it. Maybe knowing the truth will put an end to her nightmare.

My investigation has come to an end. I don't know what else I could look for around here. There was no devil, but evil there was in abundance. I should go and tell Johanka about it. Maybe knowing the truth will put an end to her nightmare.
Sir Hans Capon is presently busy with a certain matter that absolutely must take precedence over our mission to Trosky Castle - the pursuit of true love. Trosky will just have to wait.
Sör Hans Capon şu anda Trosky Kalesi'ndeki görevimizden daha fazla önem teşkil eden bir meseleyle meşgul, gerçek aşkı aramakla… Trosky beklemeli.
Now I should let Sir Hans know how I've fared as his page.
Şimdi gidip, Sör Hans'a uşağı olarak bu işin nasıl üstesinden geldiğimi söylemeliyim.

I listened to the whole tragic story and I decided to try and find out what I could about it. The best way was to enrol in the tournament myself. The prime suspect was one of the combatants, Peter, who was known as Black Peter for the colour of the armour he wore. But although I asked around at the tourney, I wasn't able to find out anything convincing.

Trajik hikayenin tamamını dinledim ve bu konuda elimden geleni yapmaya karar verdim. Soruşturmayı yürütmenin en iyi yolu, turnuvaya bizzat katılmak. Baş şüpheli de turnuvanın katılımcılarından biri. Giydiği zırhın renklerinden dolayı çevrede Kara Peter olarak biliniyor. Ancak turnuvada soruşturmama rağmen, ikna edici herhangi bir bilgiye ulaşamadım.

I listened to the whole tragic story and I decided to try and find out what I could about it. The best way is to enrol in the tournament myself. The prime suspect is one of the combatants, Peter, who is known as Black Peter for the colour of the armour he wears.

Trajik hikayenin tamamını dinledim ve bu konuda elimden geleni yapmaya karar verdim. Soruşturmayı yürütmenin en iyi yolu, turnuvaya bizzat katılmak. Baş şüpheli de turnuvanın katılımcılarından biri. Giydiği zırhın renklerinden dolayı çevrede Kara Peter olarak biliniyor.
The blacksmith was disappointed, but he thanked me for trying at least.
Demirci hayal kırıklığına uğradı ama en azından denediğim için bana teşekkür etti.
I should let the blacksmith know how I got on.

I'd given up on the whole investigation, which was leading nowhere, when suddenly things took an unexpected turn - Black Peter ambushed me! I told the blacksmith about it and we both agreed the same thing must have happened to his son. Of course it won't bring Svatopluk back, but at least his father has some peace of mind from knowing the truth.

Soruşturma hiçbir yere varmadığı için tam vazgeçiyordum ki beklenmedik bir olayın ardından işler değişti. Kara Peter bana pusu kurdu! Demirciye bu durumdan bahsettim, artık ikimiz de aynı şeyin oğlunun da başına geldiği konusunda hemfikiriz. Tabii ki bu, Svatopluk'u geri getirmeyecek ama en azından babası gerçeği öğrendi ve biraz da olsa yüreğine su serpildi.

I'd given up on the whole investigation into Svatopluk's death, which was leading nowhere, when suddenly things took an unexpected turn - Black Peter ambushed me! I should tell the blacksmith about it.
Soruşturma hiçbir yere varmadığı için tam vazgeçiyordum ki beklenmedik bir olayın ardından işler değişti. Kara Peter bana pusu kurdu! Demirciye bunu anlatmalıyım.

I'd heard the whole tragic story of Svatopluk's death and it soon became clear to me who the culprit was. Who other than Black Peter, who sneakily lay in wait and ambushed me after I'd won the tourney? I told the blacksmith about it and we both agreed the same thing must have happened to his son. Of course it won't bring Svatopluk back, but I could see it game his father some peace of mind.

Svatopluk'un ölümünün trajik hikayesinin tamamını dinledim ve yakın zamanda suçlunun kim olduğunu anladım. Kara Peter'den başka kim, ben turnuvayı kazandıktan sonra sinsi bir şekilde bekleyip beni pusuya düşürmüş olabilir ki? Demirciye bu durumdan bahsettim, artık ikimiz de aynı şeyin oğlunun da başına geldiği konusunda hemfikiriz. Tabii ki bu, Svatopluk'u geri getirmeyecek ama en azından babası gerçeği öğrendi ve biraz da olsa yüreğine su serpildi.

I'd given up on the whole investigation, which was leading nowhere, when suddenly things took an unexpected turn - Black Peter ambushed me! I told the blacksmith about it and we both agreed the same thing must have happened to his son. Of course it won't bring Svatopluk back, but at least his father has some peace of mind from knowing the truth.

Soruşturma hiçbir yere varmadığı için tam vazgeçiyordum ki beklenmedik bir olayın ardından işler değişti. Kara Peter bana pusu kurdu! Demirciye bu durumdan bahsettim, artık ikimiz de aynı şeyin oğlunun da başına geldiği konusunda hemfikiriz. Tabii ki bu, Svatopluk'u geri getirmeyecek ama en azından babası gerçeği öğrendi ve biraz da olsa yüreğine su serpildi.
I'd given up on the whole investigation into Svatopluk's death, which was leading nowhere, when suddenly things took an unexpected turn - Black Peter ambushed me!
Soruşturma hiçbir yere varmadığı için tam vazgeçiyordum ki beklenmedik bir olayın ardından işler değişti. Kara Peter bana pusu kurdu!
I found the footbridge. Now I should go towards the waterworks.
I found the footbridge. Now I should go towards the waterworks.
I'll go and have a look at the other pools that are up higher.
I'll go and have a look at the other pools that are up higher.
There should be a rocky creek leading from the pools of the waterworks.
There should be a rocky creek leading from the pools of the waterworks.
I found the rocky stream. Now to follow it up the hill - the cave should be nearby.
I found the rocky stream. Now to follow it up the hill - the cave should be nearby.
I managed to take Ambrose for the six hundred Groschen he said he had. Maybe he'll finally understand dice could cost him his livelihood.
I managed to take Ambrose for the six hundred Groschen he said he had. Maybe he'll finally understand dice could cost him his livelihood.

Ambrose boasted he had six hundred Groschen for buying cloth in Kuttenberg. If I can win it all from him, it should teach him quite a lesson. But I need to have at least 1300 Groschen to stay in the game.

Ambrose boasted he had six hundred Groschen for buying cloth in Kuttenberg. If I can win it all from him, it should teach him quite a lesson. But I need to have at least 1300 Groschen to stay in the game.
Johanka wanted Matthias to take her to the dance, but she was too shy to ask him. I promised to help her and in the end I succeeded. Let's hope it works out for them.
Johanka wanted Matthias to take her to the dance, but she was too shy to ask him. I promised to help her and in the end I succeeded. Let's hope it works out for them.
I promised Johanka I'd persuade Matthias to ask her to the dance, but I haven't done a very good job as a matchmaker. I can only hope fate will intervene to bring them together somehow.
I promised Johanka I'd persuade Matthias to ask her to the dance, but I haven't done a very good job as a matchmaker. I can only hope fate will intervene to bring them together somehow.
Johanka wants Matthias to take her to the dance, but she's too shy to ask him. I promised to help her. Either I can carry out her plan, or come up with my own.
Johanka wants Matthias to take her to the dance, but she's too shy to ask him. I promised to help her. Either I can carry out her plan, or come up with my own.
What a matchmaker I am! I stole Matthias's dice and gave it to Johanka.
What a matchmaker I am! I stole Matthias's dice and gave it to Johanka.
I didn't manage to steal Matthias' dice.
I didn't manage to steal Matthias' dice.

Johanka's plan involved stealing Matthias' lucky dice, which he keeps locked up in his trunk when he's not out playing. Once I have it, I've got to bring it to Johanka, so she can blackmail him... that is, prove her love for him.

Johanka's plan involved stealing Matthias' lucky dice, which he keeps locked up in his trunk when he's not out playing. Once I have it, I've got to bring it to Johanka, so she can blackmail him... that is, prove her love for him.

Fritz initiated me into the secrets of lockpicking. He really seems to know what he's doing. And millers are supposed to be dishonest? It seems carpenters aren't much better. Well... I know of one honest carpenter, but he's been dead for centuries.

Fritz initiated me into the secrets of lockpicking. He really seems to know what he's doing. And millers are supposed to be dishonest? It seems carpenters aren't much better. Well... I know of one honest carpenter, but he's been dead for centuries.

If I'm to open Matthias' locked trunk without a key, I'll need a lockpick and some advice on how to use it. Like Fritz, for instance. And even if I don't need to get into that trunk now, who knows, a skill like that might come in handy in the future.

If I'm to open Matthias' locked trunk without a key, I'll need a lockpick and some advice on how to use it. Like Fritz, for instance. And even if I don't need to get into that trunk now, who knows, a skill like that might come in handy in the future.
If I'm to open Matthias' locked trunk without a key, I'll need a lockpick and someone to advise me how to use it. Like Fritz, for instance.
If I'm to open Matthias' locked trunk without a key, I'll need a lockpick and someone to advise me how to use it. Like Fritz, for instance.
Thanks to my skill in keeping irate butchers at bay, Sir Hans had time to bring the affair to a satisfactory climax, so to speak. For which he suitably rewarded me.
Kasapları meşgul etme yeteneğim sayesinde Sör Hans gecesini memnun edici bir şekilde bitirmeyi başardı. Karşılığınında da beni cömertce ödüllendirdi.
I failed. Sir Hans met with Karolina, but the murder I committed in the meantime by her house cast a dark shadow on the whole affair...
Başarısız oldum. Sör Hans Karolina'yla buluştu ama benim aynı anda işlediğim cinayet ilişkiye gölge düşürdü.

Sir Hans met with Karolina as planned, but it didn't turn out quite the way he anticipated. I failed to delay the butcher long enough and he burst in and caught Sir Hans and his daughter "in flagrante". To cut a long story short, His Young Lordship took a proper beating and it's all my fault.

Sör Hans Karolina'yla buluşmayı başardı ama sonu umduğu gibi olmadı. Kasabı yeterince uzun süre meşgul edemedim ve Sör Hans'la kızını "flagrante" yakaladı. Uzun lafın kısası Lort hazretleri benim yüzümden iyi dayak yedi.

I heard the whole tragic story of Svatopluk's death and enrolled in the tourney myself. Unfortunately, I had to confess to the blacksmith that I couldn't find out anything that would shed light on the murder.

Svatopluk'un ölümünün trajik hikayesinin tamamını dinledim ve turnuvaya bizzat katılmaya karar verdim. Ancak ne yazık ki oğlunun ölümünü aydınlatacak bir şey bulamadığımı demirciye itiraf etmek zorundaydım.
I need to find water for Samuel, to drink and to bathe his wounds. Matthew said there should be some in the mine.
I need to find water for Samuel, to drink and to bathe his wounds. Matthew said there should be some in the mine.
I’ve done what Sir Hans asked of me and I'm to visit him in the morning for further instructions.
Sör Hans'ın benden istediğini yaptım ve sabah olunca onun yanına dönmem gerek.
I did what Sir Hans asked of me. Now I should go and see him again.
Sör Hans'ın benden istediğini yaptım. Şimdi gidip onu tekrar görmeliyim.
Sir Hans was far from pleased with me. Of course, it wasn't the last tourney and I still had a chance to enrol in the next one to make up for it. But I didn't manage that either.
Sör Hans benden hiç memnun kalmadı. Tabii ki son turnuva bu değildi ve hâlâ bir sonrakine katılıp hatamı telâfi edebilirdim. Ama bunu da başaramadım.
Old Blaha will know who won the dice tournament. I just have to ask him.
Zar turnuvasını kimin kazandığını yaşlı Blaha bilir. Ona sormam gerek.
I managed to beat young Pechuna and win the tournament.
I didn't succeed in beating young Pechuna and winning the tournament.
To win the dice tournament, I'll have to beat Pechuna.
Zaar turnuvasını kazanmak için Pechuna'yı yenmem gerek.

As if he weren't already irresistible enough, Sir Hans wants me to get him Musk of Infinite allure from a certain charlatan... that is, a certain learned healer. He believes it will ensure his success with the fair Karolina.

Sanki kendisi yeterince itici değilmiş gibi Sör Hans gidip de bir şarlatandan onun için Sonsuz Cazibe İksirini almamı istiyor. Şarlatan da alaylı şifacının teki. Karolina kesin olarak tavlamasına yardım edeceğine inanıyor.

Since we let Hagen's brigands get good and drunk before attacking them, some of them weren't even capable of joining in the battle. I sent them to meet their Maker stinking of wine. Alcohol is indeed the scourge of mankind.

Hagen'in adamlarının içip iyice sarhoş olmalarını beklediğimiz için, adamların bir kısmı çatışmaya katılamadılar bile. Onları kolayca diğer dünyaya gönderdim. Şüohe yok ki alkol tüm kötülüklerin anasıdır.
The bandits who were too drunk even to join the skirmish have to be taken care of too, before they sober up.
Çatışmaya katılamayacak kadar sarhoş olan eşkiyaların bile işleri bitirilmeliydi, ayılmadan önce.
So I brewed the cure against poisoning, with my own fair hands. That will surely come in handy one day.
So I brewed the cure against poisoning, with my own fair hands. That will surely come in handy one day.
That herb woman is a sly old crone, getting me to learn how to brew the potion myself. I hope it will be interesting.
That herb woman is a sly old crone, getting me to learn how to brew the potion myself. I hope it will be interesting.
I killed that so-called fearless fellow. Now there's no one left in Ledetchko to frighten. But I'll have to make up some story for the charlatan. He mustn't connect me with the murder.
O sözde korkusuz olan arkadaşı öldürdüm. Artık Ledetchko'da korkutacak kimse kalmadı ama şarlatana bir yalan sıkmam gerekecek. Benim cinayetle bir ilgim olduğunu anlamamalı.
The tourney was cancelled, probably on account of some crime. I'll have to wait a week for the next one.
Büyük ihtimalle suç unsuru teşkil eden bir şey yüzünden turnuva iptal edildi. Bir sonrakine katılmak için bir hafta beklemek zorundayım.

Kuno's band took up where the previous uninvited guests had left off and began filling their bellies. It wasn't exactly chivalrous behaviour, but after all, to the victor the spoils! I'd earned a little recreation too, so I joined in the merriment.

Kuno'nun çetesi kendilerinden önce gelen davetsiz misafirlerin kaldığı yerden devam edip midelerini boldurmaya başladılar. Çok kahramanca bir davranış değil ama, kazanan ganimeti kapar! Ben de dinlenecek zaman buldum ve eğlenceye katıldım.

Once we'd defeated the raiders, Kuno's band took up where the previous uninvited guests had left off and began filling their bellies. Maybe I should point out the error of their ways. Or, I could just join them...

Eşkiyaların işin hallettikten sonra, Kuno'nun adamları kendilerinden önceki davetsiz misafirlerin kaldığı yerden devam edip, midelerini doldurmaya başladılar. Belki de yaptıklarının hata olduğunu söylemeliyirm. Ya da, ben de onlara katılabilirim.
I got too far away from Sir Hans. I'd better get back to him quickly.
Sör Hans'tan fazla uzaklaştım. Yanına dönsem iyi olacak.
I should have done what Sir Anselm said and avoided getting into negotiations with Sir Erhart. I gave myself away and the whole plan fell to pieces.
Sör Anselm'in sözünü dinleyip Sör Erhart'la pazarlığa oturmamam gerekirdi. Foyam ortaya çıktı ve bütün plan mahvoldu.
I managed to avoid getting into negotiations with Sir Erhart and kept him at a safe distance.
Sör Erhart'la pazarlık etmekten kaçındım ve muhabbeti ortada tutmayı başardım.
I'll have to promise the tailor's wife to return the money I win, otherwise she won't agree with my plan.
I'll have to promise the tailor's wife to return the money I win, otherwise she won't agree with my plan.
Zbyshek got into a fight and was bleeding. I bandaged up the wound for him.
Zbyshek got into a fight and was bleeding. I bandaged up the wound for him.
Zbyshek got into a fight and was bleeding. I didn't help him though. Why should I?
Zbyshek got into a fight and was bleeding. I didn't help him though. Why should I?
Zbyshek got into a fight and is bleeding. I suppose I ought to help him... A bandage should do it.
Zbyshek got into a fight and is bleeding. I suppose I ought to help him... A bandage should do it.
I sat down with Ambrose, told him some stories and plied him with alcohol until he drank himself under the table.
I sat down with Ambrose, told him some stories and plied him with alcohol until he drank himself under the table.
If I don't want to play Ambrose, I could try getting him so drunk that he remembers nothing, then I could take all his money and convince him he lost it all at dice. That ought to teach him a lesson.
If I don't want to play Ambrose, I could try getting him so drunk that he remembers nothing, then I could take all his money and convince him he lost it all at dice. That ought to teach him a lesson.
I managed to show Ambrose that playing dice costs him more than it gives him. He promised he'd quit playing.
I managed to show Ambrose that playing dice costs him more than it gives him. He promised he'd quit playing.
I promised the tailor's wife I'd try and get her husband to stop gambling.
I promised the tailor's wife I'd try and get her husband to stop gambling.
I must talk to the Sasau tailor's wife, because I promised Johanka I'd help her.
I must talk to the Sasau tailor's wife, because I promised Johanka I'd help her.
The blacksmith himself can ask his son how he died. He's gone to join him in the hereafter.
Demirci şimdi gidip bizzat oğluna nasıl öldüğünü sorabilir. Nasıl olsa artık beraberler.
I took Amrbrose's money while he was unconscious, so I can tell him he lost it all at dice.
I took Amrbrose's money while he was unconscious, so I can tell him he lost it all at dice.
I managed to get Ambrose to drink himself into oblivion! And Ma was always telling me I'd learn nothing useful hanging around in taverns... Now I just have to take his money and that'll be that.
I managed to get Ambrose to drink himself into oblivion! And Ma was always telling me I'd learn nothing useful hanging around in taverns... Now I just have to take his money and that'll be that.
The older you get, the worse the hangover, and Ambrose realised he didn't have what it took to carry on like a young buck.
The older you get, the worse the hangover, and Ambrose realised he didn't have what it took to carry on like a young buck.
I have to wait until Ambrose comes round and I can play with his mind and get him to promise he'll quit playing dice.
I have to wait until Ambrose comes round and I can play with his mind and get him to promise he'll quit playing dice.
When Ambrose told me what I'd been up to, I swore to myself I'd never touch another drop of booze. Although, once my head stopped pounding, my resolve started to fade a little...
When Ambrose told me what I'd been up to, I swore to myself I'd never touch another drop of booze. Although, once my head stopped pounding, my resolve started to fade a little...
That didn't go quite according to plan. It was Ambrose who was supposed to end up under the table, not me. I should ask him what happened yesterday...
That didn't go quite according to plan. It was Ambrose who was supposed to end up under the table, not me. I should ask him what happened yesterday...

An unfortunate choice of words has denied me access to the robber baron's camp. Now no one will believe I'm Sir Alphonse. I'll just have to find some other way of solving the problem. Ideally when everyone's back is turned.
Sözlerimi doğru seçmediğim için haydut baronun kampına giremedim. Artık benim Sör Alphonse olduğuma kimse inanmaz. Sorunu çözmek için başka bir yol bulmam gerek. Tercihen herkesten gizli bir yol.

I announced myself officially at the camp entrance and could proceed safely... that is, as safely as I could in a nest of cutthroats. I'd have to watch my step if I didn't want to end up like the real Sir Alphonse.

Kampın girişinde kendimi tanıttım ve sorunsuz br şekilde içeri girdim. Yani artık katillerle dolu bir yer ne kadar sorunsuz olursa. Sonumun Sör Alphonse gibi olmasını istemiyorsam adımlarıma dikkat etmeliyim.
Charging headlong into a camp full of nervous, heavily armed brigands probably isn't the wisest strategy. I'd better politely announce my arrival at the "main gate".
Bir grup sinirli ve silahlı haydutun olduğu bir kampa bodoslama dalmak akıllıca olmaz. Ön kapıda kendimi nazik bir şekilde tanıtsam iyi olacak.
The blacksmith himself can ask his son how he died. He's gone to join him in the hereafter.
Demirci şimdi gidip bizzat oğluna nasıl öldüğünü sorabilir. Nasıl olsa artık beraberler.

Johanka's preaching was very well received. It even convinced one Pavel of Kolin, a merchant, to make amends for a sin that has troubled him for years. To do so, he wanted to recover a stash of Groschen and a dagger he hid away in the woods near Sasau. It was quite a long haul, but in the end I found the place.

Johanka's preaching was very well received. It even convinced one Pavel of Kolin, a merchant, to make amends for a sin that has troubled him for years. To do so, he wanted to recover a stash of Groschen and a dagger he hid away in the woods near Sasau. It was quite a long haul, but in the end I found the place.

Johanka's preaching has been very well received. It even convinced one Pavel of Kolin, a merchant, to make amends for a sin that has troubled him for years. To do so, he wants to recover a stash of Groschen and a dagger he hid away in the woods near Sasau. He attempted it himself, but all he has to show for it is some scratches and bruises, so I offered to help. Fortunately he was able to direct me roughly to the hiding place. I'm supposed to start between the Sasau quarry and the marshland at the point where a woodland stream flows into the river. If I follow the stream uphill, I should find a woodland path that joins it. Pavel lost his hat there. If I follow the path closely, it will lead me to an abandoned settlement deep in the woods. The hiding place is in one of the ruins there.

To do so, he wants to recover a stash of Groschen and a dagger he hid away in the woods near Sasau. He attempted it himself, but all he has to show for it is some scratches and bruises, so I offered to help. Fortunately he was able to direct me roughly to the hiding place. I'm supposed to start between the Sasau quarry and the marshland at the point where a woodland stream flows into the river. If I follow the stream uphill, I should find a woodland path that joins it. Pavel lost his hat there. If I follow the path closely, it will lead me to an abandoned settlement deep in the woods. The hiding place is in one of the ruins there.

Kuno was right about Merhojed. On a routine patrol of the area, we found a freshly torched farm and the attackers even left a message for Sir Radzig - a letter and shield with a coat of arms. Now we knew who we had the honour of dealing with - Sir Hagen of the House of Zoul, an impoverished noble who blames Sir Radzig for the loss of his estates. He even challenged my liege lord to a duel, which Sir Radzig is not inclined to accept.

Uzhitz'e giderken Hagen'in zayıflatma görevinin başka bir örneğine denk geldik. Şafak vaktinde, Zoul'un adamlarının arkadaşlarına işkence ettiği bir çiftlikten kaçan bir kıza rastladık. Ne yazık ki Kuno bu durum ile fazla ilgilenmedi ve neredeyse hiç umursamadı.
Once Kuno and his band are rested back at the camp, we can set out on another mission.
Kuno ve çetesi dinlenmek için kampa döndüklerinde, başka bir göreve hazırlanabiliriz.

On the way to Uzhitz we came across another testimony to Hagen's campaign of attrition. In the twighlight we ran into a girl who had fled from a nearby mill where Zoul's men were terrorizing her friends. Unfortunately, Kuno hasn't much more chivalry about him than Hagen and showed precious little sympathy for their plight.

Üçüncü devriyemiz de olaylı geçti. Zoullar bizi Sasau'ya yakın bir geçitte bizi tamamen hazırlıksız yakalayıp pusuya düşürdüler. Neyse ki, Kuno'nun liderliğinde bu tuzaktan kurtulduk ve düşmana oldukça fazla kayıp verdirdik. Kendimizi toparladıktan sonra, birinin bize ihanet ettiği konusunda fikir birliğine vardık, ve Jakey'nin bize getirdiği bilgiler doğrultusunda hareket ettiğimiz için ve çatışma esnasında Jakey'i ortalıkta hiç görmediğimiz için, hainin kim olduğunu anlamamız zor olmadı.
Once Kuno and his band are rested back at the camp, we can set out on another mission.
Kuno ve çetesi dinlenmek için kampa döndüklerinde, başka bir göreve hazırlanabiliriz.

Our third patrol was not without conflict either. The Zouls ambushed us at a ford near Sasau and caught us entirely off guard. Fortunately, under Kuno's command we fought our way out of the trap and inflicted heavy casualties on the foe. Once we'd gathered our wits, we concluded that someone had betrayed us, and since we'd been acting on information brought by Jakey, and he'd vanished right before the encounter, it didn't take much to figure out who the traitor was.

Yaşanan olaylardan sonra, devriye atan çeteye katılmadım. Bunun yerine Kuno bana başka bir görev verdi - benden Jakey'i bulmamı ve Hagen hakkında bildiği her şeyi öğrenmemi istedi. Jakey'i bulmam zor olmadı - şansı varken kaçmak yerine, kazandığı otuz gümüşü harcamak için Glade' deki Hana gitmişti. Ama ilahi adalet yerini bulmuştu, onu bir ağaca bağlı şekilde bulmuştum ve bu durum onu sorgulamamı oldukça kolay hale getirmişti. Bir sürü şey öğrendim, ama Jakey' den öğrendiğim en önemli şey, Hagen Zoul'un Samopesh'e bir pusu kuracağıydı...
Once Kuno and his band are rested back at the camp, we can set out on another mission.
Kuno ve çetesi dinlenmek için kampa döndüklerinde, başka bir göreve hazırlanabiliriz.

In the light of recent events, I didn't accompany the band on patrol as usual. Instead, Kuno charged me with a different task - to find Jakey and get him to reveal everything he knew about Hagen. Jakey wasn't too difficult to track down - instead of fleeing while he had the chance, the fool had gone to the Inn in the Glade to spend his thirty pieces of silver. But divine justice intervened, and I found him tied to a tree in the woods, which made interrogating him quite convenient. Among other things, Jakey revealed that Hagen Zoul was planning to lead an attack on Samopesh himself...

In the light of recent events, I didn't accompany the band on patrol as usual. Instead, Kuno charged me with a different task - to find Jakey and get him to reveal everything he knew about Hagen. Jakey wasn't too difficult to track down - instead of fleeing while he had the chance, the fool had gone to the Inn in the Glade to spend his thirty pieces of silver. But divine justice intervened, and I found him tied to a tree in the woods, which made interrogating him quite convenient. Among other things, Jakey revealed that Hagen Zoul was planning to lead an attack on Samopesh himself...
Once Kuno and his band are rested back at the camp, we can set out on another mission.
Kuno ve çetesi dinlenmek için kampa döndüklerinde, başka bir göreve hazırlanabiliriz.
Despite all my efforts, I wasn't able to save my brother. Like the rest of my family in Skalitz, Samuel is gone...
Despite all my efforts, I wasn't able to save my brother. Like the rest of my family in Skalitz, Samuel is gone...
Samuel's in a bad way. He won't survive without my help. I must find everything I need to treat him.
Samuel's in a bad way. He won't survive without my help. I must find everything I need to treat him.
In the woodcutters' camp I found woodcutter Julian still alive amongst the corpses. He was in shock.
In the woodcutters' camp I found woodcutter Julian still alive amongst the corpses. He was in shock.
The woodcutters' camp is just below the walls. If anyone survived there, I was too late to help. I found only corpses.
The woodcutters' camp is just below the walls. If anyone survived there, I was too late to help. I found only corpses.
The woodcutters' camp is just below the walls. I wonder if someone could have survived there?
The woodcutters' camp is just below the walls. I wonder if someone could have survived there?
I came across Marosh on the edge of the woods, desperately searching for his betrothed, Pavlena.
I came across Marosh on the edge of the woods, desperately searching for his betrothed, Pavlena.
Some of the Skalitz villagers could have fled to the woods, but I found only lifeless bodies.
Some of the Skalitz villagers could have fled to the woods, but I found only lifeless bodies.
Some of the Skalitz villagers could have fled to the woods. I should go that way and see if anyone survived.
Some of the Skalitz villagers could have fled to the woods. I should go that way and see if anyone survived.
I found Jarmila hidden in a hut near the works, terrified out of her wits.
I found Jarmila hidden in a hut near the works, terrified out of her wits.
In the works near the mines there are lots of places that survivors could hide. But it seems someone got there before I did.
In the works near the mines there are lots of places that survivors could hide. But it seems someone got there before I did.
In the works near the mines there are lots of places that someone could hide. I should search the place carefully.
In the works near the mines there are lots of places that someone could hide. I should search the place carefully.
I found Master Potter Stanislav in front of his house.
I found Master Potter Stanislav in front of his house.
Someone could have taken cover at the potter's smallholding, but if they did, I'll never know. There were only corpses to be found.
Someone could have taken cover at the potter's smallholding, but if they did, I'll never know. There were only corpses to be found.
Someone could have survived at the potter's smallholding, since it was out of the way of the attack.
Someone could have survived at the potter's smallholding, since it was out of the way of the attack.

A bathhouse wench came to Johanka and told her that her preaching on the square inspired her to live a more virtuous life. Johanka was pleased and got the idea to try and save more prostitutes. So I set out for Ledetchko, where there was one such wench...

A bathhouse wench came to Johanka and told her that her preaching on the square inspired her to live a more virtuous life. Johanka was pleased and got the idea to try and save more prostitutes. So I set out for Ledetchko, where there was one such wench...

A bathhouse wench came to Johanka and told her that her preaching on the square inspired her to live a more virtuous life. Johanka was pleased and got the idea to try and save more prostitutes. By chance, there's one in Ledetchko who might be persuaded.

A bathhouse wench came to Johanka and told her that her preaching on the square inspired her to live a more virtuous life. Johanka was pleased and got the idea to try and save more prostitutes. By chance, there's one in Ledetchko who might be persuaded.
I ought to go and see how Johanka is doing. I'm sure she'll be glad to hear I've done penance for my sins.
I ought to go and see how Johanka is doing. I'm sure she'll be glad to hear I've done penance for my sins.

Johanka told me there was just one more sinner who needs saving. I was a bit taken aback when I found out she meant me! She rhymed off a list of my sins that she knew of. It's quite a burden on my soul and to relieve the weight of my transgressions, I set out on a pilgrimage of repentance to Uzhitz.

Johanka told me there was just one more sinner who needs saving. I was a bit taken aback when I found out she meant me! She rhymed off a list of my sins that she knew of. It's quite a burden on my soul and to relieve the weight of my transgressions, I set out on a pilgrimage of repentance to Uzhitz.

Johanka told me there was just one more sinner who needs saving. I was a bit taken aback when I found out she meant me! She rhymed off a list of my sins that she knew of. It's quite a burden on my soul and to relieve the weight of my transgressions, I have to go on a pilgrimage of repentance to Uzhitz.

Johanka told me there was just one more sinner who needs saving. I was a bit taken aback when I found out she meant me! She rhymed off a list of my sins that she knew of. It's quite a burden on my soul and to relieve the weight of my transgressions, I have to go on a pilgrimage of repentance to Uzhitz.
To relieve the burden on my soul, on the way to Uzhitz I stopped off and prayed at the sacred sites I passed on the way, at least one for each of my sins.
To relieve the burden on my soul, on the way to Uzhitz I stopped off and prayed at the sacred sites I passed on the way, at least one for each of my sins.

Johanka said that to relieve the burden on my soul, on the way to Uzhitz I should stop off and pray at the sacred sites I pass on the way, at least one for each of my sins. She doesn't need to know I skipped that though, does she?

Johanka said that to relieve the burden on my soul, on the way to Uzhitz I should stop off and pray at the sacred sites I pass on the way, at least one for each of my sins. She doesn't need to know I skipped that though, does she?
Johanka said that to relieve the burden on my soul, on the way to Uzhitz I should stop off and pray at the sacred sites I pass on the way, at least one for each of my sins. Is it really necessary?
Johanka said that to relieve the burden on my soul, on the way to Uzhitz I should stop off and pray at the sacred sites I pass on the way, at least one for each of my sins. Is it really necessary?
In the church in Uzhitz I prayed at length to the Virgin Mary to unburden my sinful soul.
In the church in Uzhitz I prayed at length to the Virgin Mary to unburden my sinful soul.
Once I arrive in Uzhitz I should go to the Marian church there and pray to the Virgin Mary in front of her picture on one of the walls.
Once I arrive in Uzhitz I should go to the Marian church there and pray to the Virgin Mary in front of her picture on one of the walls.
In Uzhitz I prayed to the Virgin Mary and gave Father Godwin a donation for the church there.
In Uzhitz I prayed to the Virgin Mary and gave Father Godwin a donation for the church there.
Johanka said I should make some donation to the Uzhitz Church.
Johanka said I should make some donation to the Uzhitz Church.

When I told Godwin the whole story of what had brought me to Uzhitz, it made quite an impression on him, especially what I said about Johanka. He lent me a copy he'd made of a manuscript by Matthew of Janow, in which I could find out more about the matter.

When I told Godwin the whole story of what had brought me to Uzhitz, it made quite an impression on him, especially what I said about Johanka. He lent me a copy he'd made of a manuscript by Matthew of Janow, in which I could find out more about the matter.

When I told Godwin the whole story of what had brought me to Uzhitz, it made quite an impression on him, especially what I said about Johanka. He promised to lend me a copy he'd made of a manuscript by Matthew of Janow, which should cast some light on the matter. I should go and see him when he's found it.

When I told Godwin the whole story of what had brought me to Uzhitz, it made quite an impression on him, especially what I said about Johanka. He promised to lend me a copy he'd made of a manuscript by Matthew of Janow, which should cast some light on the matter. I should go and see him when he's found it.
All that remained was to settle accounts with the raiders, for which I enlisted the help of the whole band. Together, we gave the reprobates the punishment they deserved.
Yapılacak tek şeyin yağmacılar ile hesaplaşmak olduğunu ve bunun çete için de en doğru karar olduğunu düşünüyorum.

All that remained was to settle accounts with the raiders. Kuno and his men would surely be glad to help, but I figured it was best to strike while the iron was hot and deal with them myself. Soon I could return to the rest of the band with the satisfaction that justice had been done.

Yapılaca tek şey yağmacılar ile hesaplaşmak. Kuno ve adamları bana yardımcı olmaktan mutlu olacaklardır ama bazı şeyleri olay daha taze iken yapmak ve onlarla kendi başıma hesaplaşmak şu anda yapılacak en uygun şey. Ondan sonra çetenin yanına gidip, adaletin yerini bulduğunu gururla söyleyebilirim.
It seems I've spoken to everyone who's involved in this affair and now I should tell the Bailiff how Josef was poisoned.
It seems I've spoken to everyone who's involved in this affair and now I should tell the Bailiff how Josef was poisoned.

While I was looking for the bath wench, I heard a row going on in the bathhouse. I looked into it and found out the bath wench was arguing with a customer and he was putting her in her place in no uncertain terms.

While I was looking for the bath wench, I heard a row going on in the bathhouse. I looked into it and found out the bath wench was arguing with a customer and he was putting her in her place in no uncertain terms.
There's a noisy row coming from inside the bathhouse. It sounds like some bath wench is having trouble with a customer. I should check it out.
There's a noisy row coming from inside the bathhouse. It sounds like some bath wench is having trouble with a customer. I should check it out.

I questioned Jakey while he was nicely tied up. Of course he was full of regret and feeling sorry for himself. Anyway, I managed to get out of him that Hagen was intending to attack Samopesh. Then the question was, what to do with him? Well, it looked like he'd got a lesson from Maria he'd never forget, so I let him go.

Jakey'yi güzelce bağlı bir şekilde sorguladım. Elbette işin bşaında çok pişman ve kendisi için çok üzgün haldeydi. Her neyse, ondan Hagen'in Samopesh'e saldırmaya karar verdiğini öğrendim. Şimdi asıl soru, onunla ne yapacağımdı. Baktım ki Maria'dan unutamayacağı bir ders almış, salıverdim gitti.

I questioned Jakey while he was nicely tied up. Of course he was full of regret and feeling sorry for himself. Anyway, I managed to get out of him that Hagen was intending to attack Samopesh. Then the question was, what to do with him? I wasn't going to let him escape justice after betraying not only me and Kuno, but also Sir Radzig. So, I took him to the Rattay jailhouse.

Jakey'yi güzelce bağlı bir şekilde sorguladım. Elbette işin bşaında çok pişman ve kendisi için çok üzgün haldeydi. Her neyse, ondan Hagen'in Samopesh'e saldırmaya karar verdiğini öğrendim. Şimdi asıl soru, onunla ne yapacağımdı. Sadece Kuno'ya ve bana değil, aynı zamanda Sör Radzig'e ihanet etmişken onun adaletten kaçmasına izin veremezdim. Ben de onu Rattay nezarethanesine götürdüm.

I questioned Jakey while he was nicely tied up. Of course he was full of regret and feeling sorry for himself. Anyway, I managed to get out of him that Hagen was intending to attack Samopesh. Then the question was, what to do with him? I wasn't going to let him escape justice. The penalty for treachery is death, so I saved the executioner the trouble.

Jakey'yi güzelce bağlı bir şekilde sorguladım. Elbette işin bşaında çok pişman ve kendisi için çok üzgün haldeydi. Her neyse, ondan Hagen'in Samopesh'e saldırmaya karar verdiğini öğrendim. Şimdi asıl soru, onunla ne yapacağımdı. Onun adaletten kaçmasına izin veremezdim. İhanetin cezası ölümdür, ben de celladı fazla mesaiden kurtarmış oldum.

I questioned Jakey while he was nicely tied up. Of course he was full of regret and feeling sorry for himself. Anyway, I managed to get out of him that Hagen was intending to attack Samopesh. Then the question was, what to do with him? I wasn't going to let him escape justice. I could drag him all the way to the jailhouse in Rattay, or do the executioner's job myself. On the other hand, it looked like the hand of God had already intervened, and who was I to question that. So I left him tied up. Either someone would rescue him or he'd rot there until the crows got him.

Jakey'yi güzelce bağlı bir şekilde sorguladım. Elbette işin bşaında çok pişman ve kendisi için çok üzgün haldeydi. Her neyse, ondan Hagen'in Samopesh'e saldırmaya karar verdiğini öğrendim. Şimdi asıl soru, onunla ne yapacağımdı. Onun adaletten kaçmasına izin veremezdim. Onu Rattay'daki nezarethaneye kadar sürükleyebilirdim ya da celladın işini kendi başıma halledebilirdim. Ama bir açıdan Tanrı'nın eli olaya müdahale etmiş gibiydi ve ben kimdim ki bunu sorgulayacaktım. Böylece onu orada bağlı halde bıraktım. Ya birisi onu kurtaracaktı ya da kargalar yem olana kadar orada çürüyecekti.

I discovered another interesting thing from Jakey: in my absence from the company, Kuno had been complaining a lot about serving Sir Radzig without reward. Jakey passed that information on to Hagen, and Hagen is planning to take advantage of it and try to bribe Kuno. I'd better be prepared for that and try to keep Kuno from falling for the bait.

Jakey'den başka ilginç bir şey daha öğrendim. Ben yanında değilken Kuno, Sör Radzig'e bedelsiz olarak hizmet etmekten yakınıyormuş. Jakey bu bilgiyi Hagen'e iletmiş, Hagen de bu durumdan faydalanmak için Kuno'ya rüşvet vermek gayesindeymiş. Bunun için hazırlanmalı ve Kuno'nun yemi yutmamasını sağlamalıyım.
I got hold of a bow, just in case we do run into any wolf.
I got hold of a bow, just in case we do run into any wolf.
I didn't bother getting that bow before we left. That talk about a wolf is surely nonsense anyway.
I didn't bother getting that bow before we left. That talk about a wolf is surely nonsense anyway.
If we do actually run into that wolf, it's better to have a bow than be empty-handed.
If we do actually run into that wolf, it's better to have a bow than be empty-handed.
I got arrows. A bow's no good without them...
I got arrows. A bow's no good without them...
A bow needs arrows, but I didn't manage to get very many.
A bow needs arrows, but I didn't manage to get very many.
A bow without arrows is about as much use as a cart without wheels.
A bow without arrows is about as much use as a cart without wheels.
On the way, we came across a magpie's nest. Bianca had seen the bird carrying something shiny there. I knocked it down from the tree and looked inside. There was a ring there!
On the way, we came across a magpie's nest. Bianca had seen the bird carrying something shiny there. I knocked it down from the tree and looked inside. There was a ring there!
On the way, we came across a magpie's nest. Bianca had seen the bird carrying something shiny there. If I can somehow get the nest down, we can see what's in it.
On the way, we came across a magpie's nest. Bianca had seen the bird carrying something shiny there. If I can somehow get the nest down, we can see what's in it.

I talked to Johanka and she gave me quite a telling off about my deeds. She wanted me to go on a pilgrimage of penance to the Marian church in Uzhitz and pray for forgiveness for my sins. Johanka was right - I did have a thing or two on my conscience, so I did as she asked.

I talked to Johanka and she gave me quite a telling off about my deeds. She wanted me to go on a pilgrimage of penance to the Marian church in Uzhitz and pray for forgiveness for my sins. Johanka was right - I did have a thing or two on my conscience, so I did as she asked.

"How love turned to bloodshed. Once there was a knight who, though upright and noble-looking, had a prickly, unapproachable appearance. He fell in love with a fragile young maid, whom he saw with her sisters in a field, all wearing bright red wimples. But he was afraid his prickly exterior would frighten her, so he asked the advice of another knight, a pious and learned crusader, who carried the name of the patron saint of his order with pride. The pious knight told him he would arrange a rendezvous with the maid, all three would drink wine together by the river and he would help his friend to get acquainted with her. This they did, but the maid fell in love instead with the pious knight. The stern knight was enraged and challenged his rival to a duel. The two fought long and fiercely, but they were equally matched, and so in the end they both fell, mortally wounded. Anguished at the tragedy her beauty had caused, the young maid took a dagger from one of the knights and plunged it into her own heart. Their bodies lay together on the ground, and the blood flowed from them into the river, turning the waters crimson." The charlatan says I have to figure out from the fable the names of the three herbs for the potion, which I have to grind and brew together for one turn.

"Aşk nasıl da katliama dönüştü. Bir zamanlar oldukça onurlu ve asil ama huysuz ve yanına yaklaşılmaz bir şövalye varmış. Bir çayırda kardeşleriyle birlikte oturan genç, kırılgan bir kıza aşık olmuş. Kızların hepsinin parlak kırmızı şalları varmış. Ancak huysuz mizacı kızı kendinden uzaklaştırır diye korkmuş ve başka bri şövalyeden yardım istemiş, yolunda yürüdüğü azizin adını gururla taşıyan, dindar ve savaş görmüş bir şövalye. Dindar şövalye de ona kızla bir randevu ayarlayacağına söz vermiş. Hep birlikte nehir kenarında yemekte buluşacaklar ve dindar şövalye arkadaşını kızla tanıştıracakmış. Öyle de olmuş. Ancak kız dindar şövalyeye tutulmuş. Huysuz şövalye buna çok sinirlenmiş ve rakibini düelloya davet etmiş. İki şövalye uzun süre ve cesurca savaşmış ama yenişememişler. Sonunda ikisi de ölümcül yaralarla yere düşmüşler. Genç kız güzelliğinin sebep olduğu bu trajediye dayanamamış ve şövalyelerden birini hançerini alarak kalbine saplamış. Cansız bedenleri beraber nehir kenarında yatarken kanları nehre akmış ve suları kıpkırmızı yapmış." Şarlatan iksir için ihtiyacım oan üç otu hikayeden çıkarmam gerektiğini söyledi. Sonra da bu otları beraberce ezip bir tur kaynatmalıyım.
